results.description:
This is a QK outdoor doubles event on grass. It is a friendship tournament event meetup consisting of doubles matches played in a King-Queen format, meaning that you will be playing with and against different people during pool play. Assuming an equal gender signup, matches will be reverse coed. Top players after pool play will compete in a playoff format. Cost: $0. The River has free car parking. It is 1.6 miles from Harvard Square. You can take your bike on the MBTA Red Line on weekends.

This is a friendship tournament format, meaning call your own faults, as there are no referees.

The organizers for these events will be Matt BenDaniel and Brian Lee.

We will be using the ruleset listed in the first post on the following: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/messages/boards/thread/8548572?thread=8548572

The event will start at 10:30 AM and will likely last at least until mid afternoon (~3:30 PM). If you would like to play in this event you must commit to staying at least through the end of pool play. Remember to bring snacks/food and water/beverages, as this event will involve a significant amount of volleyball play.

This event is intended for players with experience playing reverse coed doubles format. To sign up for this event, send an email to Brian using the following link on meetup: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=4774008&subject=6/14-RCO

In the email, provide the following information:

* Name
* Gender
* Unless we already know you well, please include a detailed description of your reverse coed doubles experience. It is *your* responsibility to truthfully convince us you have the skillz. If you're a beginner to doubles, you should check out other tournaments which offer B/BB level.
* Confirm that you have read the ruleset at the link above and that you agree to play by those rules.
* Confirm that you can commit to play from 10:30 AM to 3:30 PM.
* Signup partner name (if you have a signup partner)

Preferably, each player in a signup pair should send an email.

For this event we will aim to have player numbers in a multiple of four so that there are no sitouts for players. Preference is given to AA/A players who sign up in male/female pairs. Single signups will initially be placed into the event to as needed to achieve gender balance, although if there is a lack of signups near to the event date we will allow gender imbalance in the roster. Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you are added to the event page.

The trail is 8.5 miles from Arlington center to Bedford and we ride at a moderate pace.This event auto-repeats monthly and may be leaderless.

Lunch afterwards at Not Your Average Joes, 645 Mass Ave.

Suggested donation $1 for Meetup fees.

This ride happens only if its a nice, clear day above 40 .

Wear a helmet, bring water and sunscreen, watch out for children on the trail, and have a good time!

 

The Minuteman Bikeway passes through the historic area where the American Revolution began in April 1775.

Today, the Minuteman Bikeway is one of the most popular and successful rail-trails in the United States, enjoyed for both healthy recreation and transportation.

The bikeway has become a new type of “Main Street” where neighbors and strangers alike come together while riding, walking, or skating on the path.

In 2008, Rails-to-Trails Conservancy inducted the Minuteman Bikeway into the national Rail-Trail Hall of Fame.

Hey everyone! Come join us for this fun 5K on Sunday June 14, 2015. It includes admission to the Irish festival too. So why not complete a 5K (I'll be running, but walkers are welcome too!) and then party it up Irish style? Details below.

The Irish Cultural Center of New England is proud to host the 3rd Annual Boston Irish Festival 5K Road Race on Sunday June 14, 2015 at 11:00 a.m. in Canton, Mass. This is part of the Boston Irish Festival, and all participants will receive free entry into the festival which begins at noon following the race (Festival runs both Saturday, June 13 and Sunday, June 14). Great Commemorative T-shirts will be given to pre-registered participants who sign up by May 15th and will also be available for sale on race day. Personalized keepsake bib numbers will also be issued to those who register by May 15th . The post race party will include snacks and Guinness will be on tap! Participants also receive FREE ADMISSION to the Boston Irish Festival with bib number.

This event is open to athletes of all abilities. Wheelchairs are welcome, and walkers are also encouraged to attend. The course is flat, and begins and ends on the grounds of the beautiful Irish Cultural Center. Early bird entry fee is $25.00 (plus processing fees) through April 30 and $30.00 until registration closes on June 11 at midnight. Race Day registration available for $35.00, 9:00 a.m. to 10:45. For more information, please visit our website irishculture.org.

To register go to http://www.lightboxreg.com/irish-festival
results.name: Third Annual Boston Irish Festival 5K Road Race

results.description:
Hey all!

I've gotten ALOT of inquiries about Adult level classes, as most of the public classes posted here are geared towards kids 6-18. Most of the adult level classes we run are normally through private clinics or classes and I'd really like to get any/everybody involved and moving. 

I'm thinking to run these Sundays at 11 AM, but if we as a group can figure out a better/more accessible time I'd love to hear it. I just assume most people have work off, parking is free and the city is a bit less congested than normal. 

Onto the class specifics...

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before? 

This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun


http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the main courtyard up the stairs. The location itself is of concrete construction, and has yellow rails!
results.name: [Boston] Parkour 101 - Introduction to Parkour

results.description:
You are invited to the FREE introductory session about the Art of Living Happiness Program.

The session includes:
• Knowledge of Mind-Body-Breath
• Relaxing Breathing Techniques
• Guided Meditation

Brief info on Happiness Program:
• Discover the hidden laws that govern the mind and learn skills to enhance one’s health and mental well-being.
• Practices that heal and harmonize the body, mind, and spirit
• Skills for handling negative emotions and situations
• Stretching and low-impact yoga for health, circulation, and body stillness
• The masterpiece of the Art of Living Course is a powerful breathing-based technique called Sudarshan Kriya® or the healing breath

No Prior experience of Yoga or Meditation is necessary


Shalin is the Director of Volunteer Training for the Art of Living Foundation in the United States and an instructor of the Happiness Program. Shalin is a long-time practitioner of these techniques himself and has been committed for over a decade to sharing this incredible knowledge with others. Over the past 17 years, Shalin has organized and taught the Happiness Program throughout the United States, Canada, Mexico and India, for people from diverse arenas including: undergraduates, educators, engineers, attorneys, healthcare professionals and entrepreneurs.

Parking is available at the CambridgeSide Galleria Mall ($3). The venue is easily accessible by walking from Green Line MBTA Lechmere Station.
results.name: An Introduction to The Happiness Program (with Shalin)

results.description:
Come and join us for open board gaming at Excelsior!  They have a large gaming area to seat approximately 50 gamers in addition to a growing board game library that patrons may take right off the library shelf and play at-will.  They have also dedicated their Sunday schedule for just this open board gaming event, so us board gamers will have the pick of the tables during the entirety of the event which happens to run the entire time the shop is open on Sundays.

Attendees are welcome to bring in their own games or use games from the library.  Bobby will also run game demos during the event in case you want to learn a new game or simply try before you buy.

In case you are interested in purchasing the game from the demo session, Excelsior will offer 10% off the price of purchasing a new copy of that game that day on top of the 10% discount they are offer to all MBG members (for a total discount of 20% off).  If for some reason they are out of stock of the demo game and must special order it for you that day, they will order it for you and allow you to take an additional 10% special order discount on top of the previous two discounts for a total discount of 30% off!

Want to special order something that is not the demo game?  Add the base MBG 10% discount and the 10% special order discount together for a total of 20% off any special orders.

Nourishment:  The shop carries various snacks and non-alcoholic beverages if you need something to snack or sip on while you game.  For more substantial food, there are many eateries located within walking distance from the shop on Main Street.

Parking:  Excelsior has an agreement in place with the Jiffy Lube at 3 Powder Mill Road.  Attendees may park in the lot behind the Jiffy Lube building.  From there, it is a short walk across Powder Mill Road to the Excelsior's door on the corner of Powder Mill and Waltham Street, which is the 4-way intersection closest to Jiffy Lube.
results.how_to_find_us: On the corner of Waltham Street and Powder Mill Road, park behind the Jiffy Lube

results.description:
This is the new, regular meetup on Sundays at noon at Brooklyn Boulders in Somerville. Look for the dark-haired guy with glasses and yellow Katana climbing shoes who keeps falling off the bouldering wall. I'll have my stuff on the first table/bench thing by the entrance. I primarily boulder, but hopefully we'll get a good variety of climbing interests coming so that everyone can follow their climbing passion!

(Credit to Francesco Cardiello for the information below):
BKBS is the gorgeous, new, state-of-the-art climbing gym most convenient to those in the Boston, Cambridge, and Somerville area. Although pricier, it features 60+ feet toproping and lead climbing, a massive 22 x 140 foot bouldering wall (and there's still another upstairs), yoga & fitness classes, a sauna, awesome water fountains that fill your water bottle, a retail store, lounge area, weight room, and a soon to open cafe! There's even a collaborative work space where you can study, work, and climb!
If you are looking for a partner or just want to get your climb on join us on Wednesdays for a fun time.

FAQ:

How do I get there? BKBS is conveniently located within a 10 minute walk of the Porter Square station. Walk down Somerville Avenue and turn right on Properzi way and head all the way down. It is also very bike accessible. If you drive, you can find the lot at 30 Dane St. It is located next to Artisans Asylum.

Why should I do this meetup? Since BKBS is such a new community (opened in late July 2013) few people have developed regular climbing partners to train and climb with. This is a great opportunity to meet other climbers interested in BKBS. Climbing is an inherently social sport - to top rope and do lead, you need to meet people who are dedicated to climbing. The Wednesday meetup assures you'll meet a partner to regularly climb with. We are looking to expand to other nights in the future.

What if I haven't climbed before? First off, don't be intimidated. Everyone started somewhere. If you have never belayed before, please make sure to take the Learn the Ropes class. More info can be found here: http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before using the walls. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need? You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time? Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): Day Pass - $22 (Students $18)
10 Pack - $200 (Students $169)

RENTALS: Shoes - $5
Harness - $5
Chalk Bag - $2
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Somerville Sunday

I'm going to marathon it on Sunday and see two more of the Roy Andersson films at the MFA, The first up is A Swedish Love Story. I'm setting up two different meetups so you can choose one or both.

Description of the film, from the MFA website:

Andersson’s first feature was a great critical and popular success in his home country. With the gorgeous Swedish summer as a backdrop, the film portrays the pure love that arises between the daughter of a refrigerator salesman and the son of a car mechanic, offering a glimpse into the lives and homes of the people of the Swedish Social Democracy during its heyday. Andersson’s debut is a typically stirring mélange of comedy and melancholy, the quotidian and the absurd.
results.name: Roy Andersson's A Swedish Love Story --Quirky Swedish Art Cinema, Part 2

results.description:
Join me for a kayak paddle along the Concord River in Billerica, Bedford and Carlisle with a stop at the Two Brothers Rocks historic site in Bedford.  Along the way, learn about the river from your wetland scientist eco-tour leader, and watch the wildlife including great blue herons, osprey, hawks, red wing blackbirds, cormorants, geese, ducks, beavers and turtles.  

Bring your own gear or rent one of mine.  No SUPs or infatables.  14 foot minimum length is required to keep the group together.  10 foot boats have had difficulty keeping pace with the longer boats even at our casual kayaking pace. 

The available rental kayaks are not suitable for people over 6 feet tall, or > 220 lbs.   A paddle and PFD is provided or bring your own.  To rent a kayak you must call or text me (Ed) at[masked] to discuss your experience level and fit for available kayaks. Click here for further details abot the rental kayaks: 

Concord River Kayak - Rental Page

Here is a link to the Rental Agreement

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO: Hold harmless, and indemnify the organizers and their relations and heirs, and all members and participants of the Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment. As organizers we make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. This is not a guided tour. In the interest of safety, consuming alcohol before or during any Casual Kayakers event is not allowed. Wearing of Lifejackets (PFD's) is required when paddling with this group.  No dogs or other pets are allowed for this trip.

results.description:
Come join us for an advanced barefoot hike at the Blue Hills Reservation.  Several spots along these trails offer great views, including the Boston skyline.  We will hike the red dot trail up to the observation tower on Great Blue Hill and then follow the Skyline (blue dash) trail over to the Milton State Police station.  From here we will take the return loop of the Skyline trail back to the tower and then follow the red dot trail back to the parking lot below.

This hike provides quite a bit of climbing over some pretty rocky terrain.  This is probably about as tough as it gets this far East in Mass.  We will cross a few areas with gravel, scree and broken sharp rock.  There are several good pulls up some pretty steep, rocky slopes.  The hike will be a three to four hour workout, depending on our group.  You WILL be tired at the end, but it's a good tired :)

New barefooters are welcome to join us on these fun trails.  However, I ask that they please bring along shoes for the scree, gravel, and other tough places.  There are some nice boulders and rock faces that are fun for new feet.  Everyone is welcome.

All hikers NEED to bring water.  Carry at least one liter (if it's hot bring extra).  There are picnic tables at the Police station so bring a snack and we'll stop there for a little break.  Restrooms are available at the start and midpoint of the hike.  Tick repellant is recommended, although I've never had a problem on these trails.  A walking stick or trekking poles will be handy on the steep downgrades.  Those not sure of their ability PLEASE bring backup shoes.  Those who know me know how much I despise shoes but this is a TOUGH place to barefoot.

Meet in the parking lot near the red dot trailhead.  This is the parking lot that is between the ski area and the Trailside Museum.  Meet at the end of the lot closest to the Trailside Museum.  Additional parking is available on the other side of the Trailside Museum.  Look for barefoot people.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for barefoot people in parking lot
results.name: Advanced barefoot hike at Blue Hills

results.description:
There's a new bridge game in town, and she's beautiful. Please join us for an afternoon of competitive party bridge.

Bertucci's has its own parking lot, lots of tables, a welcoming vibe, and hearty food (including all-you-can-eat salads and soups).

Be sure to sign up by Saturday afternoon, the day before the game. If at least 5 players have not registered by then, the game will have to be cancelled for that week.

You must know Contract Bridge rules and basic bidding to play this week. No formal training is to be offered, but this is a social, casual event. To assist novices, bidding advice and meanings will be openly discussed on any player's request.

ACBL Yellow Card is our group-standard bidding system; a novice should please take time to study all basic openings and responses shown above in yellow, plus standard Jacoby Transferand Stayman responses to NT openings. We will expect a verbal alert on deviations an expert may make to these most-common conventions.

results.description:
How might you benefit from taking time to actually get to know the different, sometimes conflicting parts of yourself, your Inner Voices?


• Learn how to call forth specific energies such as confidence and personal power on demand.  

• Align your various Voices with your needs and intentions as an adult.


• Start or continue healing the wounded Parts (like Inner Children).

John Howe will guide us in deepening our connections and understanding of these different parts of our psyche, using Parts Work and Voice Dialogue. This is an expansion, by demand, of John's awesome Harmonizing Your Inner Voices program. Learn about working with specific types of parts.


Learn and practice, under the guidance of an expert, the tool you can use yourself to get to know and work with your various parts.  It's called Active Imagination (written dialoguing with your parts), originally created by Carl Jung. 

Gain inner harmony by getting to know the inner cast of characters and what they really want. 

This program is both a stand-alone program and a deepening of prior Inner Voices programs by John.  We've kept the price low to encourage more people to take advantage of this work.

Our Leader: John Howe 

John works with clients at stuck places or transition points in their lives, and helps them uncover what they want to do and how to move forward. Examples include marital problems, career decisions, or searching for a strong sense of purpose in their lives.

Often it’s someone whose life is working pretty well, but they KNOW in their bones that there’s more for them to do now, something different. They ache to start doing it, but stay stuck, not  moving. If you were in their shoes, how would you feel?  It can be awful! Fortunately there is help that can ease you across the threshold into that wonderful next phase of life.

John uses powerful tools that give people clarity, direction, and the power to move beyond their obstacles. This brings incredible peace of mind. After he works with them, they make better decisions, move forward more quickly and effectively and are able to step into the life they’ve been yearning for.  Their life is working better and they feel much more positive about who they are, with more peace and joy.

For example:  a great marriage, a career that fits them perfectly or a life that reignites their passion.

If you have a feeling that there is something more for you and you don’t know what it is, or you do know but you’re feeling stuck, check out this program, or give John a call at[masked]-3460.

results.description:
****Welcome to the Cosplay Creations Series****

This series is meant to bring a mix of people together who are interested in cosplaying... Maybe you've never cosplayed before but want to and are nervous about it; maybe you've made cosplays in the past and want to do more; maybe you're a cosplayer looking for people to do a group cosplay with; or maybe you're just curious about cosplay in general. All are welcome.

Disclaimer

This event is hosted by Lisa and Wendy. We are not seamstresses. We are not going to make a cosplay for you.

What to Expect...

Our first event will be a Meet and Greet for members to swap cosplay ideas or find people who wish to group cosplay to find like-minded individuals. This will be at a public location; however, after that events may be hosted at public locations or at Lisa or Wendy’s private addresses. So if you are nervous about meeting someone for the first time in their home, then I recommend you join us for our first Meet and Greet event and then pick and choose your future events from there.

Some of our events will include, but are not limited to…
• Cosplay Brainstorming
• Group Cosplay viewings
• Supply Hunts aka trips to Goodwill, thrift stores, and fabric stores
• Sewing days
• And more…

I like the idea but I’ve never cosplayed before...

It takes a lot of courage to put on a costume and attend conventions, or parties, or to go to the grocery store. I, Wendy, speak from experience. The first time I cosplayed I was in my 30’s and had to walk through a very large crowd of “normal people” (I use that team jokingly of course. We are all normal. Well… I’m mostly normal… lol) A few years later, I was so comfortable cosplaying, that it wasn’t unusual for you to see me grocery shopping with Zombie make-up on my arm or buying cleaning supplies while wearing a Lolita maid cosplay (purely coincidental I assure you, but very ironic). This is a judgment free zone, so please feel comfortable that you are among friends.

What is the cost?

There is no cost to attend Cosplay Creation events; however, depending on the activity, you are responsible for your own purchases and supplying your own materials for any cosplay you wish to create.

Directions / Transportation

We will organize carpools from Boston where possible; however, most events will be train or bus accessible. Each event will list how to get there and will give members a chance to organize any carpool that may be needed.

Our first event is in the courtyard of the Boston Public Library located in Copley Square. This is accessible via the green line. There are also parking garages in Boston and free street parking on Sundays. Just be aware that many side streets in Boston require a resident permit, so please use caution when parking.
results.how_to_find_us: We are meeting in the Courtyard of the BPL. Call/text me @ 978-604-2853 if you have trouble finding us. Please reference the anime group so i know who you are. :)
results.name: Cosplay Creations Meet and Greet

results.description:
Let’s go to a polo match! The match starts at 3 p.m. and lasts until about 4:30 pm but we will start networking around 1:45pm. Admission is $10 per person and paid to Myopia as you are entering the club. People please bring things such as cheese and crackers, fruit, wine, cake, cookies, etc.


We will be at the field at 1:30 pm and we will try to secure a spot on the shaded side of field right hand side of the bleachers. Please park in parking lot and walk over to our area on far side of the field, we will have banners up as to where we will all be sitting.

This is a casual event and shorts are fine however many folks dress up and hats, sundresses etc is encouraged.

If everyone could bring a dish to share and drinks that would be great. Please bring your own chair or blanket. Also if you have a table that would help.

Anyone who has not spoken to me is asked to park in the parking lot and not on the field. This is a popular event and we usually have over 50 attending so I can’t have 50 cars on the field. This event will cancel due to rain so please watch your emails.

The last polo match was amazing. Don’t miss out.

Event Venue
————————–————-
Myopia Polo Club
————————–————-

Myopia Hunt Club is a foxhunting and private country club, located at 435 Bay Road in South Hamilton, Massachusetts. It was founded in 1882 by J. Murray Forbes. The name “Myopia” is due to some of its founding members having come from the Myopia Club in Winchester, Massachusetts, which had been founded by four brothers with poor vision, or myopic. Today, the Myopia Hunt Club is a drag hunt, meaning that the hounds follow a laid scent rather than live fox.

Myopia also boasts one of the oldest continually running polo fields in the nation. Gibney Field, formerly used as a pasture, was mowed and used for practice in the summer of 1888. That fall, Myopia held its first official match against the Dedham Polo and Country Club. In 1890, Myopia became one of seven charter members of the Polo Association, now the United States Polo Association. Of those seven original clubs, Myopia is one of two still in existence (Meadowbrook on Long Island is the other.) It is the only one that still uses its original field.

www.myopiapolo.org

Event Sponsors
——————–
Cannabis Society
——————–
The Cannabis Society is the 1st country club in America dedicated to creating events around marijuana’s multiple uses. We are a non-profit social club organization dedicated to creating a community and events around marijuana’s medical and recreational value. Our core goals include providing up to date information on the location of the latest dispensaries, doctors, lawyers, and other important players in the marijuana industry in Massachusetts for our members as well as covering cannabis in context with the health, arts, sciences, culture, and technology.

http://cansociety.org/

——————–
ReformMA.com – Massachusetts Cannabis Legalization Discussion Forum
——————–

Join the conversation! ReformMA.com is a public discussion forum to start the conversation on regulating and controlling cannabis in Massachusetts that will feature a crowdfunding campaign.

Our goal is to create an easy to understand regulatory framework that controls and taxes marijuana while encouraging small business development, increased state revenue, and new innovative practices.

We want to ensure the initiative allows for the friendliest economic environment in the country for cannabis startups and scientific research companies to create innovative new products and services.

http://www.reformma.com/

——————–
BeanPot
——————–
BeanPot is a volunteer driven non-profit Massachusetts Cannabis News and Culture Online Magazine that is focused on the needs of marijuana users in greater New England. From locally inspired edible recipes, to cannabis dispensary and strain reviews BeanPot stands to give Massachusetts a world class source for all things cannabis.

http://beanpot.co/

————————––
Legal Disclaimer
————————––
Views or opinions expressed by speakers or sponsors at our local Cannabis Society community events do not necessarily express the opinion or views of the Cannabis Society organization and we do not take responsibility for the views expressed or the actions of speakers or sponsors at our local events. The Cannabis Society does not distribute cannabis.

————————––
The Cannabis Society of Massachusetts is Growing
————————––
Our group has grown by leaps and bounds these past few years and we are proud to announce that the Cannabis Society is going to continue to grow and develop our ecosystem with groundbreaking events centering around medical cannabis, technology, art, and science. We couldn’t do it without our members and we want to thank you for being apart of this growing organization.
results.name: The Polo Affair

results.description: Something new this year. We are moving the members show from September to June. So please bring your trees whether they are show ready or not for advice on how to get them ready. Remember there are cash prizes($15 for 1st, $10 for 2nd & $8 for 3rd),ribbons as well as the club trophy up for grabs. There is a novice class(if you've never entered or won a blue ribbon before),plus 4 different sizes to enter and the saikei(landscape or seascape usually with rocks)class. So bring your different size trees to prepare. You either should have done all the work on a tree to enter it, or have worked it for at least 2 years. We usually have everyone who wants to, talk about their trees. How they've obtained them, the work they've done so far and what their goals are. Normally, I'd tell you how I look forward to seeing you all there, but, unfortunately I'll be away that week. There also is a good chance for a special surprise at this meeting. So please be sure to attend.

results.description:
Ah, summer: the time of new possibility, of walks in the woods and commencement ceremonies encouraging us to dream big and nourish our spirits. In one of the most famous commencement speeches of all time, Ralph Waldo Emerson's 1838 Harvard Divinity School address, Emerson urged graduates to transcend their reality, to "go alone," rather than following religious dogma. As a community of atheists, agnostics and allies, we tend to agree with Emerson about dogma, but what about 'going alone'?

In a brief talk and longer discussion (including small breakout groups), Greg will take the beginning of what many call the "most spiritual season" as an opportunity to explore the relationship between humanism and spirituality. Should humanism be spiritual? In what ways? Hint: when Don Draper went to the famous Esalen Institute at the end of TV's "Mad Men", he wasn’t just seeking his navel. He went to a place informed by humanistic psychology, where a higher priority was placed on human connection and community than on "transcendence". What would such a place look like here in Boston, in the 21st century, under the summer sun?
results.name: Greg Epstein: Don't Go Alone: Humanism & Spirituality from Emerson to Don Draper

Our June meetup will be back in Harvard Square, and a bit earlier than usual. 

We'll meet at 1:30pm on June 14th to introduce ourselves & find out the prompt. Then we'll head out to find images inspired by the prompt. 

After an hour, we'll re-convene to talk about the challenge and share our results.

When the meeting is over we will post our favorite photos to the group photo album and instagram  (#improvphotoma)

For drivers to the meetup: Cambridge parking is free on Sunday: meters are free and permit spots are open to all.

See you there!

.

Hey All 

It looks like it going to be a spectacular day and we have over 100+ going from 6 groups.

Here are a few rules and directions 

1. Park in the parking lot.   Only those who I spoke to personally can drive on field.   we have a set spot with a large crowd and i can.t take up space with cars.

2. If you have a fold up table that would help please email me  we could use an extra one or two

3. Thanks for all of those who posted what they are bringing.  If you have not posted please do so and read what folks are bringing.  I would say we have enough cheese and crackers.  {I once was at a house party for 20 and 19 brought dessert so please read the comments and post what you are bringing} a Case of water would be a good idea

4. Everyone always ask how to dress.  You can wear shorts and a T Shirt and fit in fine.  However some people like to dress up a bit and many women wear sundress and hats. 

5. Gates open at 1;30 PM and we will be on the shaded side closest to the parking lot.   Look for Jimmy and his truck.  I have an open house and will be there as soon as I can.  

6.  Drinking is allowed on the field and if you would like to bring a wine or champagne glass please do so.  { We don't have hide anything }

Joan

Come and meet up for a fun outdoor workout!! This will be a 2.5 mile moderate hike on the Strawberry Hill Trail at Hale Reservation.  We can also extend the hike and do the Page & Sadie Trail (1.7 miles), which loops around Noanet Pond.
http://halereservation.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/2007HaleMapFront.pdf

Meet at the Powissett Parking Area!  When you arrive, Go past the main office on the left. Continue up the road for about 1.5 miles. The parking area is on the left, and Powissett Lodge is a little further up the road.

Info:  Hale Reservation is a private, non-profit educational organization that manages 1,137 acres of woodlands, including four ponds and over twenty miles of trails.  This beautiful hike will weave on and off Hale property and up and over some hills.
results.name: Hiking at Hale Reservation

results.description:
New England Aquarium

Join us!

This coming weekend we are sketching the NE Aquarium by Chief architect Peter Chermayeff and Co. Weather is promising! Just don't swim in the Shark's tank like a random visitor did the other day :P Bad idea! :)

The New England Aquarium in Boston opened in 1969 and became a precedent-setting prototype for many future aquariums. It is a phenomenal tourist draw in its urban waterfront setting; an educational resource serving its community and region; and an early example of Cambridge Seven's ability to offer both entertainment and education through experiential design, integrating exhibits and architecture.

This unique institution is credited with a major role in the redevelopment of Boston's waterfront. Cambridge Seven Associates provided site planning, architecture, exhibit design, and all interior design for the original New England Aquarium building as well as master planning for several expansion projects, including a new Mammal Pavilion, designed by McManus Architects with exhibits by C7A and NEAq staff.
results.how_to_find_us: at the entrance of the aquarium
results.name: Let's Sketch the New England aquarium!

Over 1,200 LBT women and friends of all ages take over Perkins Street for a fun filled outdoor afternoon with vendors, food, cash bar (21+ to drink). The schedule of events:

2 pm-3 pm: Face painting for kids and live acoustic music. Crys Matthews: Curve magazine; “Fans of Tracy Chapman and Ani DiFranco will find plenty to love …Matthews shares their gifts of telling simultaneously intimate and relatable stories…with her own unique brand of R&B folk." Triana is an acoustic solo artist with the voice of an angel singing blues (covers and originals).

This year’s emcee is Sapphira Cristal, former queen of Boston Pride and current Miss Gay NY.

Her signature open format mixing and seamless genre-blending sets have won her the Boston Music Awards "DJ Artist of the Year," Improper Bostonian’s “Boston's Best DJ" and a feature at the 2015 Dinah Shore Weekend. 

Perkins Ave, between South Huntington Avenue and Centre Street Jamaica Plain, MA
All ages (children welcome)

results.description:
The second of the darkly comic films of Roy Andersson that I'll be viewing on Sunday. If nothing else, this title guarantees that you will have quite an interesting description of your afternoon to tell to others.

Description of the film, from the MFA's website (this is also the most recent of Andersson's films):
Like his previous features, Songs from the Second Floor and You, the Living, master Swedish director Roy Andersson takes up the theme of “being a human being” with this meticulously crafted, dreamlike black comedy. Sam and Jonathan, a pair of hapless novelty salesman, take us on a kaleidoscopic tour of the human condition in reality and fantasy, unfolding in absurdist episodes: a sing-along at a 1940s beer hall, an encounter with a randy flamenco teacher, the thirsty King Charles XII of Sweden en route to battle, and a diabolical metaphor for the horrors inflicted by European colonialism. It is a journey that unveils the beauty of single moments, the pettiness of others, life’s grandeur, and the humor and tragedy hidden within us all.
results.name: A Pigeon Sat on a Branch Reflecting on Existence

The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the essential life energy within.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Note: This is an unofficial meetup for those attending the Sunday, June 14, performance at 3:30pm.

http://www.bemf.org/pages/fest/opera_poppea.htm


Monteverdi’s final and most profound opera, L’incoronazione di Poppea, was first performed in Venice in 1643, only months before his death. Its exploration of the abuse of power, the drive of lust, and the triumph of love is as relevant and intriguing today as it was over three and a half centuries ago, and shows Monteverdi at the height of his powers. The smoldering center of this masterpiece is the Roman Emperor Nero’s obsessive love for the beautiful Poppea, which is brought to life by Australian countertenor David Hansen as Nerone and American soprano Amanda Forsythe as Poppea. BEMF’s four-time Grammy-nominated directors lead a revival of the critically acclaimed 2009 production of this extraordinary work.

"[An] exquistely staged, deeply moving production." -The New York Times

Video

Amanda Forsythe in BEMF's 2013 production of Handel's Almira.

David Hansen performs Handel's "Yet, can I hear that dulcet lay" at the Risør kammermusikkfest, 2011.

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE: Tavern in the Square in Porter Square

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. Look down the street. There's Tavern in the Square! If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Erika and Jack
results.how_to_find_us: We will be there signing our beautiful language to inspire all of you!
results.name: ASL WEEKLY SOCIAL

results.description:
Want to get to know another special part of Boston?  Want to see something that most Bostonians never see?  Does The Lonely Island's song "I'm on a Boat" speak to you?  Come enjoy a cruise through the Boston harbor and see the islands with us!

Per the website: "Soak up the sights and hear the history surrounding Boston's Harbor Islands on this two-hour narrated cruise aboard an intimate '20s-style mini-yacht dubbed the Beacon. The knowledgeable crew will fill you on fascinating facts as you float by Fort Independence and Fort Warren, Spectacle Island, Long Island, Lovell's Island and many others, pointing out notable lighthouses, shipwreck sites, a mysterious sunken island and more. Enjoy it all from the open bow, back deck, or shaded mid-deck. Beer, wine and sparkling wine are available for purchase, while soda and water are included."

If you want to come, you can buy discounted tickets here!  

http://www.goldstar.com/events/boston-ma/boston-harbor-island-cruise?mal=1


If the discount tickets are sold out, full price tickets are available here- (though you might be able to negotiate over the phone, if you'd like to try):

http://www.boston-sailing.com/

We might even go for drinks downtown afterward ;)

Please RSVP if you plan to come.  If you RSVP, I'll be waiting outside to hear from you, so please show up, or let me know if circumstances change!  Plus, spots are limited, so if you don't use yours, that's two people who couldn't come.  If you ditch us without warning a few times, we'll have to remove you from the group.  If you need to get a hold of me, my number is four four zero 488-5055.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet nearby at 3:45.  I'll write in the comments where we are on the day of the trip, so bring your smartphone.
results.name: Boston Harbor Island Cruise

results.description:
Seamus McLaughlin – Workshop Leader
Seamus is a multi-instrumentalist currently performing as a vocalist, percussionist, and harmonica player.
Seamus has completed the “Musicianship and Leadership” program offered by the Music for People organization (www.musicforpeople.org), as has been certified as a workshop facilitator.

Music-Making for Everyone
Experience the joys of creative music making in a safe and supportive environment. Develop skill and confidence in improvisational music as you develop a basic repertoire of techniques using voice, drums and percussion, and any instrument of your choice. Open to singers and musicians of all levels of experience. Activities include group drumming and singing, and improvisations in small group formats. Some hand drums and percussion instruments and a piano will be available. You are encouraged to bring your own instruments. All levels of experience are welcome.
results.name: Music Making for Everyone

results.description:
Give yourself the gift of relaxation and rejuvenation with a wonderful 90 minute gentle yoga and meditation class.

True relaxation is experienced by the body and mind when little or no energy is consumed. It is Nature's way of recharging. Since every action, conscious or unconscious, uses stored energy, relaxation is necessary for good health and peace of mind. Without proper relaxation the body and mind become overworked and inefficient.

When the mind is constantly bombarded by stimuli, it becomes overloaded and exhausted. We may be unaware that we are doing it, but by thinking and worrying we are using up tremendous amounts of energy. The tension put on the mind by worries can use more energy than physical work.

Yoga retrains the body to relax and can calm the mind which leads to inner peace.

This class is for beginners and experienced yogi's.  Chairs are available for those who may need to sit during this class.  Please bring your own yoga mat, water and a blanket or pillow for meditation.
results.name: Gentle Yoga & Meditation - 90 minute class

group.name: The Light Within - Yoga, Reiki, Meditation - Dorchester MA

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 37-47 - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN

venue.name: Nashoba Brook Conservation Land

results.description:
Let's explore the Trail Through Time in Acton, MA

The Trail Through Time is a bi-cultural heritage trail.  It winds through the lovely woodland along the banks and marshes of the Nashoba Brook, in the North Acton Conservation Land of the same name.  The main Trail is a pleasant two-mile loop that crosses the brook twice on rustic footbridges.  Following existing Land Stewardship trails, it accesses sites along the way where stone ruins from earlier times still exist.

Many of these ruins were constructed during the American Colonial period and later into the Industrial period of English settlement.  Quite a few, however, are the remains of simple structures left by Native Americans who may have worked this ceremonial landscape for millennia before the immigrants came.  Indians quietly continued their use for some time afterwards, until the land was all owned by European settlers.  Some assert that modern Indians still revere these sites, sacred to them, in quiet use today.
results.name: Nature Adventure - Acton's Trail Through Time

group.name: The Energy Medicine Study Group in Littleton

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/
results.how_to_find_us: Enter at The Hawthorne Building, the large glass doors to the left of H&R Block.

results.description:
At the June Dinner, Art, + Music night we'll celebrate the second anniversary of Don't Make Art, Just Make Something. Rather than having another book talk, Miranda has decided to practice what she preaches and make something. Or rather, play something.

A practicing musician, Miranda was trained in classical piano for twelve years before jumping ship to start writing folk songs on guitar. Since January 2014, she has uploaded a new song to Youtube every month as an attempt to keep the music coming despite an increasingly busy schedule. (You can see some here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-ag5FeGVRb8GT7Dc7_gluK2hasRZFWbj)

Although she has performed as the feature at Open Mics and Farmer's Markets, Miranda has never taken the plunge to be the main feature of an event. At least, not musically. But what better place to do it than at the Hearth?

So mark your calendars and join us for Hearth Founder Miranda Aisling's first real concert. As always, we will have a potluck and a jam session after the feature. If you bring a dish to the potluck you can get in for free!

Tickets are $7 or get a ticket and a copy of the Sketchbook Edition of Don't Make Art, Just Make Something for $20.
results.name: June Dinner, Art, + Music Night ft. Miranda Aisling

results.description:
Join us for a 2nd screening of an exciting movie  and discussion based on cooperatives changing the world! ***There is limited seating, so please RSVP.


Own the Change - the movie. (22 minutes)

See the trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QNOqLJG8S7M

The movie "Own the Change" is a short, practical guide for those considering worker owned cooperatives, made by GRITtv & TESA, the Toolbox for Education and Social Action.  It will cover:

• Why should we own change?

• How can we own change?

• What does "owning the change" really mean on a day to day basis?

• What is an "Action" plan?

Sunday night we will have some snacks and watch the movie, "Own the Change". We will engage in a discussion afterwards and have some breakout action workshops to help get you started, or to continue to Own the Change! We will include some announcements and coop news.

Potluck dishes are always welcome, and Agaric will supply some snacks too - please bring your favorite treat to share with the group.


Meet and mingle: 6pm - 7pm

Movie starts: 7pm

Discussion: 7:30pm

Workshop: 8pm - 9pm


Hang around and glow - more discussion: 9pm
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the event space on the second floor. Signage will be posted.
results.name: Agaric Movie Night - Own the Change!

results.description:
No contemporary filmmaker has chronicled the messy human experience with the eye and ear of a comedic cultural anthropologist like Judd Apatow. Hits as varied as those he’s directed, like Knocked Up and The 40-Year-Old Virgin, and those he’s produced, like Superbad and Bridesmaids, are all unified by their honest, unflinching, comic look at how complicated it is to grow up in the modern world. Apatow has also built a history of helping break distinctive new comedy voices into the mainstream, from Seth Rogen to Lena Dunham among many others. Now, in his fifth feature film as a director, Apatow again brings a portrait of an unforgettable character, and a portrayal by a breakout new comedy star, together in Trainwreck, written by and starring Amy Schumer (Inside Amy Schumer) as a woman who lives her life without apologies, even when maybe she should apologize. Since she was a little girl, it’s been drilled into Amy’s (Schumer) head by her rascal of a dad (Colin Quinn) that monogamy isn’t realistic. Now a magazine writer, Amy lives by that credo—enjoying what she feels is an uninhibited life free from stifling, boring romantic commitment—but in actuality, she’s kind of in a rut. When she finds herself starting to fall for the subject of the new article she’s writing, a charming and successful sports doctor named Aaron Conners (Bill Hader), Amy starts to wonder if other grown-ups, including this guy who really seems to like her, might be on to something. The comedy, from a script written by Schumer, co-stars Brie Larson, John Cena, Tilda Swinton and LeBron James. Apatow produces Trainwreck through his Apatow Productions alongside Barry Mendel (Bridesmaids, This Is 4

https://youtu.be/2MxnhBPoIx4
results.name: Trainwreck  6-14  Sun.  Paramount  7:30 PM

results.description:
Come join us for a potluck/discussion with our restoration ecologist Jim Laurie about some of the revolutionary ideas developed by Lynn Margulis on the deep relationship among microbes, and all life including humans. Explore the importance of microbial activity to restoring ecosystems and reversing global warming. Potuck 6:00-7:00 p.m. followed by discussion 7:00-9:00 p.m. at Helen Snively's place in Central Square.


Can't be there in person to attend the Meet-Up? No problem! Starting at 7:00 p.m. (after the potluck), we'll be streaming and recording it via Google Hangouts on Air so you can join us virtually or watch the video on your own time to see what you missed: http://tinyurl.com/Microbes-R-Us-Broadcast

Lynn Margulis was a microbiologist who has given us a broader and more useful view of how life developed on our planet. She insisted that symbiosis was as important to understanding evolution as natural selection. Her descriptions of microbial communities in her many books gave me great insight when developing biodiverse living systems to treat chemical wastewater.  

Having this microbial perspective has allowed Jim Laurie to understand why John Todd's "Living Machines" were successful and Allan Savory's "Holistic Planned Grazing" could restore grasslands to their former richness. She is credited with developing the theory of endosymbiosis, also known as symbiogenesis, which explains how complex eukaryotic cells evolved by a fusion of simpler prokaryotic (bacterial) cells. Creating good habitats for microbial communities is critical in all ecosystems as we are now seeing in forests, wetlands, grasslands, and even in our gut. A healthy microbiome in our intestines is a big part of our human immune system. 

Margulis enrolled at the University of Chicago at 14 years of age. She was on the faculties of Boston University for two decades before she went to UMass - Amherst in 1988. Using her more holistic view of the evolution of life on earth, she saw much value in Lovelock's Gaia Hypothesis and researched how the biodiversity of life can regulate components of earth's atmosphere, ocean salinity, and planetary temperature.

Learning what Lynn Margulis can teach us about symbiosis will give us great insight as we endeavor to create a future where humanity can thrive by restoring biodiverse ecosystems everywhere.
results.name: Microbes 'R' Us

results.description:
We are so sorry to see Shannon’s group close and appreciate all her hard work!! Beth Ann, Judy and Beth are ready to lead the group and keep the book club doors open. In addition to discussing the book in June we will also use that time to share our ideas and enthusiasm moving forward.

Come with one book suggestion (we will not be using the previous list of books) and whoever is continuing with the book group will decide what books we will read in September and October at the June meeting.

If you are interested in continuing to be a part of the club, it is very important to attend even if you have not read the June book. If you have any friends who would like to join the group women or men; please invite them. We are looking forward to many more exciting book discussions!!  

This event is free, but please support the group and the event location by purchasing a drink or meal while you are at Panera. Please do not bring outside food or drinks into Panera.

The Hearts of Horses in the winter of 1917, nineteen-year-old Martha Lessen saddles her horses and heads for a remote county in eastern Oregon, looking for work "gentling" wild horses. She chances on a rancher, George Bliss, who is willing to hire her on. Many of his regular hands are off fighting the war, and he glimpses, beneath her showy rodeo garb, a shy but strong-willed girl with a serious knowledge of horses. So begins the irresistible tale of a young but determined woman trying to make a go of it in a man's world. Over the course of several long, hard winter months, many of the townsfolk witness Martha talking in low, sweet tones to horses believed beyond repair -- and getting miraculous, almost immediate results. Ultimately, her gifts will earn her a place of respect in the community.With an elegant sweetness like that found in Plainsong, and a winning energy as in Water for Elephants, The Hearts of Horses delivers a heartwarming, greatly satisfying story about the unexpected and profound connections between people and animals.In the winter of 1917, nineteen-year-old Martha Lessen saddles her horses and heads for a remote county in eastern Oregon, looking for work "gentling" wild horses. She chances on a rancher, George Bliss, who is willing to hire her on. Many of his regular hands are off fighting the war, and he glimpses, beneath her showy rodeo garb, a sh…

Author:

Molly Gloss

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

https://2015bostonatwysspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

venue.address_1: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138
venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 2 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Large,Multigroup Weekly Walk around Fresh Pond,dinner @ Shangri-La :6/14@6:30

results.description:
Lets walk around the trails of the Arboretum.  Its easy walking with some hills..There are plenty flowers and trees to admire too!

Let me know if you have any suggestions on what you want to do/see here..If your really into nature and what to see specific aspects of the park then let us know :)

Misson Statement:

The Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University discovers and disseminates knowledge of the plant kingdom to foster greater understanding, appreciation, and stewardship of Earth’s botanical diversity and its essential value to humankind.

group.name: Active, Healthy, and Social in Eastern Mass

results.description:
Let's join five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

 

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/atwysspeeddating/"></a>

results.description:
Full Moon Gong: with Dharam Singh, Guruatma Kaur, and Siri Tapa Kaur

New Moon Gong: with Guruatma Kaur

 What to expect: Preparing ourselves with a Kundalini Yoga set we will create a body-mind balance for change and healing. While in this state the sound waves of the gong and bowls induce an extended state of effortless meditation and relaxation that facilitates the movement of prana through the body and psyche for healing. In this way, the gong is a tool that magnifies and focuses the power of the yoga experience.   


We will finish with tea, treats, and joy! 

Please bring a thick blanket or cushion to lie on and a shawl to cover with!   

“The Gong is the first and last instrument for the human mind, there is only one thing that can supersede and command the human mind, the sound of the Gong. It is the first sound in the Universe, the sound that created the Universe. It’s the basic creative sound. To the mind, the sound of the gong is like a mother and father that gave it birth. The mind has no power to resist a gong that is well played.”  -Yogi Bhajan, Master of Kundalini Yoga   

Yoga & Gong: Guruatma Kaur: An IKYTA certified teacher and devoted student of Yogi Bhajan, Guruatma Kaur has been enthusiastically teaching Kundalini Yoga since 1979. She is lovingly dedicated to encouraging clarity, excellence, and relaxation into one’s True Self.  

Gong:  Dharam Singh began an exploration of sound as a saxophonist and flutist in the Bronx, NYC - an environment immersed in the rich music and culture of Africa by way of the Caribbean, Boriqua, African American and the counter culture, which gave him a multicultural perspective on musical language.   His passion for the transformative power of sound and music has found a place in the use of the Gong as he came to develop a unifying aural language that removes the separation between Head and Heart, Body and Soul. It is these frequencies, tones and harmonics, already given by Nature that he simply lives to share.  Dharam is a long time student of Yogi Bhajan and a resident of Guru Ram Das Ashram, where he is the go-to guy for anything related to Gong Yoga, including buying one - www.gongsongs.com He is part of the 'three-some' that leads the monthly Full Moon Gong event 

Meditation: Siri Tapa Kaur, a Reiki Master, Sat Nam Rasayan Practitioner, and certified Kundalini Yoga Teacher lives a life committed to being healthy, happy, and available to all. Everyone who knows her is touched by her open-hearted, compassionate mother energy. 

Note: in case of any date discrepancy between this Meetup and the website, please believe the website!
results.how_to_find_us: Yoga at the Ashram is located at the Baba Siri Chand Yoga Center at Guru Ram Das Ashram, 368 Village St in Millis, MA 02054
results.name: Full and New Moon Yoga, Gongs, and Meditation

results.description: Do you enjoy photography and travel? Come enjoy a FREE and exclusive photo presentation at Griffin Photography Museum to talk about the wildlife of Brazil by the renowned landscape photographer and documentary filmmaker Ossian Lindholm. To fully immerse all our senses into the beauty of Argentina, we'll also be tasting the famous Torronte wines of northwest Argentina, home of the highest vineyards in the world. Registration capped at 50, so please RSVP below. Come experience the wondrous biodiversity of the Pantanal through they eyes of acclaimed South American nature photographer and environmentalist OssianLindholm. Ossian will share his captivating images of the world’s last great wildernesses, the largest contiguous wetland on the planet and South America’s primary wildlife sanctuary, declared a World Heritage Site and Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO. Through his engaging photos, he will share his knowledge of the Pantanal's incredible biodiversity which includes almost 700 bird species, 100 different types of mammals, hundreds of fish and scores of reptile and amphibian species. This wildlife photography talk will bring you up close into his special encounters with tapirs, giant anteaters, caiman, capybaras, howler monkeys, giant river otters, the Hyacinth Macaw and toco toucan, and finally the moment by moment tracking of elusive jaguar, the largest cat in the world and symbol what nature conservation tourism can achieve.
results.name: The Wildlife of Brazil’s Pantanal:  A photo presentation by Ossian Lindholm
