results.description:
This is a friendly monthly reminder to contribute $11 yearly to help us pay off the yearly Meetup Group fee and additional cost to run the group and keep the group going. This is more for member's information and is not meant to sound that I am angry. Also, note that  Biagio is NOT getting rich from the group fees.  This is a YEARLY fee and NOT a monthly fee.

I wanted to address any crazy rumors and incorrect assumptions that I am getting rich from Meetup. These assumptions are based on having ALL 9,000 members paying the $10 a member fee which would equal $90,000, but that is 100% incorrect. I am not making $90,000 a year for this group!

So please let me clarify less than 1% of the group’ members actually pay the $11 yearly Voluntarily Donation. Out of that $11 PayPal take their cut so I only get  $10 per member. I barley take in $200 a year and that is NOT enough cover the yearly Meetup fees and the other Meetup expense like printing out Meetup materials, supplies for the group, batteries, games, Meetup business cards, etc. Over the past 6 years I've acquired over $2000 of debt to run this group and cover Meetup expenses. So it is time to understand the truth and stop making assumption.

Biagio is pretty Poor and Not rich. Luckily, there hasn’t yet been a need for me to start to begging for money on the side of the street……….. yet!

I am now paying Meetup a $200  fee  every year to run the group. In 2015 we have only collected $150 from members for the Meetup Group Fee so far, and we have not paid off the 2014 debt which is over $500 now. If we cannot get members to pay off the 2014 and 2015 debt  then I’m just going to let the group shut down due to lack of  funding when the 2016 payment is due.

Don’t forget,  I pay for batteries, supplies,  printouts,  signs, games, stands  etc. etc. to run this group its over $700 a year,  which includes the $200 a year Meetup fee!

So please be informed and realize what it takes to run a group this large. Oh and add to that I spend 30+ hours every week of my own time running the group which I get paid $0 for.

Please help keep the group going. Don’t let not giving $11 a year, every year stop all the fun. Oh and you don’t have to pay the $11 online you can pay the $10 in person or e-mail me to pay by check.

If you want to pay online Meetup has shut down the Amazon payment feature so you can now pay using Paypal and pay $11 to my PayPal account using e-mail address which is [masked]

results.description:
9:00 am - Introduction to LASI 

9:15 am - DataQuest Lab - Vik Paruchuri

We'll be analyzing student data, and discussing design and data collection strategies for dataquest.io.  First, we'll walk through an interactive lesson on the dataquest platform that analyzes anonymized student data and finds points at which students drop out, or take unexpected actions.  We'll pause as we go through, and discuss why this might be happening, and try to understand the student mindset.  After we finish the lesson, we'll look at the platform more broadly, and chat about what data should be collected, and what design choices might boost learner engagement.


10:15 am - Paper Prototyping Visual Learning Analytics Workshop - Kim Ducharme, Ge Vue, Garron Hillaire

We will facilitate a process around shaping and refining both an idea for data visualization and a theory of change on how the design is attempting to setup administrators, teachers, and/or student interactions that result in a change of behavior. We will introduce what we mean by “theory of change informing design” and then move into a short introduction to paper prototyping by working in small groups on the actual development of a data visualization paper prototype. The workshop will conclude with a short discussion to consolidate the opportunities and problems in research on visualization for learning analytics.

DATA Resources

12:15 pm - Break for Lunch 

1:15 pm - Panel on Learning Sciences and Learning Analytics

Jie Chao, Chad Dorsey, Hee-Sun Lee and Charles Xie, The Concord Consortium

Learning analytics can provide important insights into learning in many domain-specific situations. When informed by research on learning, computational models and approaches can permit us to gain a richer understanding of how learners acquire and progress with scientific and engineering practices and content understanding. Panelists from the Concord Consortium will describe a variety of analytics approaches including process analytics applied to the engineering design process, text analysis of student scientific argumentation and a novel application of Bayesian Knowledge Tracing to student learning of a mechanical system in a game-like application. The panel will pay special attention to how information from these and related techniques can provide important feedback to aid teaching and learning and can contribute back to aid ongoing learning research.


2:00 pm - Panel discussion on MOOCs & Learning Analytics - Justin Reich (chair), Michael Yeomans, John Hansen, Henry Eyring

One of the three goals of edX and HarvardX is to advance the science of learning. Both the data and platforms of massive open online courses afford exciting opportunities to examine student learning behaviors in real-time, to experiment with diverse approaches to instructional design, and to characterize the scaffolds that lead to student success and the barriers that thwart learning. In this panel, graduate students and post-doctoral researchers from four departments at Harvard will introduce some of their research projects, as they relate to time-series analyses, text analysis, performance dashboards, and census-based geo-location.
results.name: Learning Analytics Summer Institute '15 Boston - Day 1

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Boston Herald
Do you ever look at someone and wonder what is going on inside their head? Disney•Pixar’s original new film “Inside Out” ventures inside the mind to find out.

Based in Headquarters, the control center inside 11-year-old Riley’s mind, five Emotions are hard at work, led by lighthearted optimist Joy (voice of Amy Poehler), whose mission is to make sure Riley stays happy. Fear (voice of Bill Hader) heads up safety, Anger (voice of Lewis Black) ensures all is fair and Disgust (voice of Mindy Kaling) prevents Riley from getting poisoned—both physically and socially. Sadness (voice of Phyllis Smith) isn’t exactly sure what her role is, and frankly, neither is anyone else.

When Riley's family relocates to a scary new city, the Emotions are on the job, eager to help guide her through the difficult transition. But when Joy and Sadness are inadvertently swept into the far reaches of Riley’s mind—taking some of her core memories with them—Fear, Anger and Disgust are left reluctantly in charge. Joy and Sadness must venture through unfamiliar places—Long Term Memory, Imagination Land, Abstract Thought and Dream Productions—in a desperate effort to get back to Headquarters, and Riley.

Directed by Academy Award® winner Pete Docter ("Monsters, Inc.", "Up"), produced by Jonas Rivera, p.g.a. ("Up") and featuring an original score by Michael Giacchino ("The Incredibles," "Ratatouille," "Up"), Disney•Pixar's "Inside Out" opens in theaters on https://youtu.be/seMwpP0yeu4

results.description:
We will focus on techniques that are powerful, but don't have to take a lot of time. With two little ones, a teenager, husband and business, I do not have a lot of time for my meditation practice. 

Come learn what I do in the brief amount of time I have to keep myself happy and ready to help clients. 

You know that practicing meditation would help lower your stress levels. You know that meditation will help you with all the chatter in your mind, with trouble sleeping, and will improve your overall well-being. You might have even sat down to meditation only to find yourself easily distracted and agitated even more! No need to give up though! Whether you tried meditation before or not, you will learn something new in this class. 

We will go over some different meditation techniques so that you find some that work better for you:

Focusing on the breath

Creating an easy imagery to visualize

Using a mantra to focus your mind

Movement meditation


We will also discuss the posture, mudras (hand-gestures), and have fun while meditating! You will feel a difference right away! 

Cost: $20
results.name: Meditation for Busy Moms

results.description:
Hi Meetup Members. Early registration is now sold out. If you would like to sign up at the regular registration rate, go to the official event site:
 https://www.eventbrite.com/e/launch-it-the-product-event-and-happy-hour-for-cross-functional-teams-tickets-16975101987


-----

To launch a successful product, it takes teamwork and collaboration. The most successful product teams are cross-functional; you'll need business, product management, engineering, design, and marketing prowess. Unlike the majority of events that focus on just one discipline, we address the needs of the entire cross-functional product team.


Launch It is perfect for CEOs, engineers, designers, and marketing professionals who want to take their products to the next level. Learn more about the upcoming Launch It events on the Perfetti Media web site.

Program and Agenda

6 - 6:30 - Cocktails and hors d'oeuvres: Grab a cocktail and meet the best and brightest people in the world of product management, design, and development

6:30 - 7:30 - Panel Discussion: It's About Delivering Great Product, Not UX Strategy

7:30 - 8:00 - Networking and cocktails

Panel: It's About Delivering Great Products, Not UX Strategy

All too often, you'll hear team members talking about UX Strategy or tactics for demonstrating the value of UX in an organization. To build great products, the best teams aren't prioritizing or highlighting the UX strategy discussion. They are shipping great stuff. They are constantly looking for opportunities to maximize the contribution of all members of the Product, Engineering, and UX team.


In this panel, we've assembled product leaders who have worked at some of the most successful technology organizations in Boston, including HubSpot, Runkeeper, Carbonite, and Acquia. We'll discuss:


• How product managers, engineers, and UX professionals can collaborate to release great products

• The challenges for delivering great products and tactics for tackling them

• How to inject design into the product process

• Best practices for releasing high-quality products

What Comes With Your $10 Registration Ticket

Your registration includes:

• Interactive panel with product leaders who have worked in the trenches at some of the most successful Boston technology companies, including Runkeeper, HubSpot, Carbonite, and Acquia

• One free drink ticket for your libation of choice, including beer, wine, and soda at our Happy Hour Bar

• Tasty hors d’oeuvres

• Networking with brilliant minds from the Boston product community

Launch It is not the typical meetup. It’s designed and tailored for passionate product managers, UX professionals, and engineers who stay awake at night thinking about what makes a best-in-class product and how to achieve that goal.

Unlike other events, the goal of the evening is to bring brilliant product folks together for a stimulating, in-depth conversation. We are seeking passionate, motivated, and energized participants who want to contribute to the conversation and share their product lessons learned along the way.

About Your Host

Christine Perfetti is the CEO and Founder of Perfetti Media, a training and consulting firm that helps teams deliver best-in-class products. Before starting Perfetti Media, Christine was Head of UX at two successful technology companies, Carbonite and Acquia.


Thank you to our sponsors!
results.name: Launch It: A Product Event and Happy Hour for Cross-functional Teams

results.description:
Everyone loves to receive a hand crafted card.  Birthday, Father’s Day, summer, thinking of you- send your love ones warm wishes with a card.  Spend the evening with Marilyn from Stampin Up as she led us in creating cards.  Cost is 6 cards for $15 or 12 for $25.

Please only sing up if you plan on attending as this meet up requires a lot of work to prepare.

This is a wonderful way to spend time with your daughters, girlfriends, nieces, granddaughters, etc... so bring a friend and create together.

If you have a special request for any Specific cards please let us know.  (graduations or weddings coming up??)

NO Perfumes or other strong scents
results.name: Card Making- let's make some cards for Dad, birthday, summer, etc.

results.description:
Map Below:


https://www.google.com/maps/place/325+Montvale+Ave,+Woburn,+MA+01801/@42.4716329,-71.0809254,13z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89e3748b1d3eb151:0x33472dd4582f4ee0


Intersection of 95 and 93 

1 mile south to: 

Exit 36 on Route 93



Montvale west 800 feet to Bickford's. 



Kitty Whist Night  New players are VERY welcome: We will teach you how to play. It is suggested that you get a drink or something else there, to compensate the hosting establishment. 


The 50 cent charge is totally voluntary and is only to approximately cover the meetup charge.

This is SOCIAL CARDS conversation is encouraged, however please be aware of when it is your turn to play a card, we try to keep the fun balanced between the two.

New people probably will play their first few hands, about an hour of instruction, with the meetup organizer and selected players before playing at-large with the rest of the group.

We eat first, talk a lot, then, after 7 - 7:15 ish, or so, we start playing. Usually the first four to six people ready to play start playing.  New people who need instruction (if any) and late people wait until a second table of 4 to 6 is ready to play.  People arriving after that time MAY have to wait until a game finishes.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be the one with the decks of cards.
results.name: Kitty Whist in Woburn @ Bickford's *

results.description:
We are thrilled to have breastfeeding expert Robin come to the group.  Robin will be talking all about breastfeeding support, where to find it, the different levels of care, supply levels and much more.  Learn more about Robin's services here: http://lchomevisits.com/.

This is a weekly meeting where pregnant women and couples come to gain new insights about childbirth choices and issues that affect pregnancy and overall health.  Hear from birth experts ranging from midwives and doulas to registered nurses, educators and holistic healthcare practitioners. At every meeting you'll have a chance to join in discussions that will enlighten your pregnancy experience with both expert tips and the experiences of other pregnant women and their partners.  

Fun, informative and inviting, this group is the perfect place to have your questions answered about prenatal nutrition, chiropractic care during pregnancy, prenatal yoga, childbirth options, doula care, breastfeeding, baby registry, cloth diapering and so much more!  Please come on your own or with your partner to learn and share your thoughts and stories.  

For more information email Dr. Lizzie Sobel @ <a>[masked]</a>.
results.how_to_find_us: This is on the same corner as Life Alive restaurant.  It's less than a 5 minute walk from the red line Central Square T stop.  There is also metered street parking and nearby garage parking available.
results.name: Breastfeeding 101: Special Guest Robin Snyder-Drummond, IBCLC

results.description:
Maybe not, but an entire team does!

Join us weekly at the BBC in Framingham to play team trivia with us. The game is played with the standard 4 quarters plus bonus questions. Everyone can play. Teams have 6 players maximum. This is important, please arrive on time! 

We form teams according to the number of people showing up before 7:30 PM.


The BBC serves great food and drinks and the venue is welcoming.

The top two winning teams get their pictures on the www.barpubfun.com website and get gift certificates, which we stock up and use later as a group.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, Patrick
results.name: Team trivia night at the BBC in Framingham

Meditation and Manifestation Mondays/every week from 7-9 p.m. we begin a whole new series of Journey Meditations in our Monday night Meditation and Manifestation Series at Angels of Light. Join us as each week as two special Divine beings join us bringing forth great movement, joy, healing and transformation. You will relax in reclining chairs, as the lights are turned down, soft rejuvenating and healing music is played and a special channeled Journey with a team of special Angels, Goddess's Ascended Masters, Saints and Divine Energies join us each week. Followed by Healing and Blessings with Rev. Cathi.  An Evening of pure light and bliss. 7-9 p.m. $20.00  

Testimonial:  Cathi I wouldn't miss this meditation and feel it has helped me to heal, move forward and open the doors to greater joy and happiness in my life.  Thank you so much, Love, Michelle
results.name: Meditation Journey Night/A Journey of Light/w the Angels & all of the Divine

results.description:
This is a class for those new to Lightroom or anyone looking to start using it.

It forms part of a three class series on consecutive Monday Evenings.

You can join any or all three.m

Class one:  importing and organizing your pictures June 1 


class Two:  post processing with the develop module   June 8 

class 3:  exporting  and printing your pictures

We will look at the various export options available in Lightroom:

Creating your picture  : choosing a file type

Custom naming

Color space and soft proofing

Printing your image

Creating a slideshow

Creating a book

The class will run from 7.30pm to 9.30pm and will cost $35

results.name: Get to grips with Lightroom 3: Exporting and Printing

results.how_to_find_us: The study will be located in the upper level dining area in the BU West Campus 7-Evelen

results.description:
Come draw some dynamic poses with us at Damon's studio- we do shorter poses here, 5 minutes to start, and ranging through 10, 20, and 30 minute poses.  Informal setting in Damon's painting studio, surrounded by his paintings and work in progress.

You can pay online in advance when you RSVP, and save time for drawing during the session.  Please customize the amount you're paying online according to whether you've paid your membership this month or not ($10 for members, $25 for a one-time drop in- which can be converted to a membership should you come back that same month). You may also pay your $25 monthly membership when that comes due each month online either together with the payment for the drawing session or separately through the link to the left on the sidebar.

Parking is on-street legally for two hours for people without Somerville parking permits, BUT WE PREFER THAT YOU PARK IN THE LOT AROUND BACK, WHICH IS OPEN PAST 11PM.  The building is a working factory, so the lot is monitored and safe, though it is a bit of a walk around the building to the front door.
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Central Street and Vernon Street, big brick building.  Park on Vernon street in front of building or in lot behind building.

results.description:
Climbing MeetUp at MetroRock Gym in Everett. Toprope, sport leading, and bouldering available, including some tall walls up to 55 feet. Whether you're a new or experienced climber, join us for a fun and solid workout! We usually have people at all levels. Gym meetups are also a great way to make more friends for outdoor climbing. Plus Mondays are ladies night: discounted admission. If you'd like to lead climb, don't forget to bring your rope :)

*** If you are new to MetroRock Gym and/or climbing, please see the FAQ below. ***

Meet at the picnic tables near bouldering area (the one furthest from the cubbies if available) from 7 - 7:10 PM.  (NOTE: In the rare case the Event Host doesn't arrive within this time window, assume major traffic jam or other catastrophy, ask others nearby to find the group, make introductions, and go climb).  If arriving later, just come find us on the walls.  Hopefully you can recognize us, the event Host(s) (see RSVP list) from our profile pictures, and/or check the small Whiteboard near the bathrooms and water fountain, for a description of what we're wearing that day.

Full-access Day Pass:  $22.  Students, Military or Bouldering-Only Pass:  $18.  Mondays are Ladies Night:  Women's Pass $14 after 3 PM & also special class pricing.

For membership, gear rentals, and other programs and pricing available, or for directions, check the gym website:  http://www.metrorock.com/

Frequently Asked Questions for Newbies:

Q) How do I get to the gym?

A) See website for directions: http://www.metrorock.com/ If you're driving here for the first time, it can be tricky to find MetroRock Everett, especially in the dark! Use a GPS if possible. MetroRock is in a building opposite Boston Coach.   If you don't have a vehicle, the gym offers a shuttle service from nearby Wellington T Station; call the gym for schedule details.

Q) I've never climbed at MetroRock Gym before, what do I need to do?

A) You'll need to take and pass a belay test for rope climbing. There is a separate test for toproping and sport lead climbing. For toproping, if you are not confident you can tie a re-threaded figure-8 knot and double fisherman's backup knot and safely belay a climber using an ATC device, it is highly recommended you take the Level 1 Safety class. They will not allow you to climb on ropes without passing a belay test. Call MetroRock in advance to reserve your spot in the class, and ask them about any discounts or special prices they are offering. Also, you can rent basic climbing gear (harness, shoes, belay device, etc), if needed, at the gym.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the picnic tables near bouldering area (the one furthest from cubbies if available).
results.name: MetroRock Monday

results.description:
Join us for an introduction to this unique Japanese martial art. Participants will all get a chance to practice some basic movements, explore a bit of the underpinning philosophy, and experience seated meditation. In short, we will have fun together learning about this martial way, one unknown to many in the United States. 

Shorinji Kempo is a relatively new martial art. It was founded just after WWII as part of a Zen Buddhist practice. Today, while the martial art has been separated from the religion, the practice of Shorinji Kempo remains true to it's Zen Buddhist roots, with philosophy and meditation still integral to the study in the dojo of hard (punches, kicks and blocks) and soft techniques (releases, joint locks and throws).
results.name: Boston Shorinji Kempo Open Dojo Event

results.description:
For our June meeting we will continue to discuss Common Core.

Common Core - we are in the thick of it! We will discuss the current and future of the fight, and what we can do. We will talk about the hearings at Bridgewater State University, which hopefully a number of us attended.

Governor Baker has directed Paul Sagan the Massachusetts Board of Education Chair to hold a series of public hearings around the state, which will solicit feedback from educators, parents, students and local officials on the PARCC exam and the real-world impact of Common Core standards on teaching and learning. The dates and locations are as follows. This is our opportunity to let our voices be heard.

The next hearing is Monday, June 22, 2015, North Shore Community College – Lynn Campus, Gymnasium, 4:00–7:00 p.m.

For those not as familiar with Common Core, we will also take some time to watch the presentation of Building The Machine. We will also see a clip or two from the hearings.

If time permits, we will talk about Evan Sayet's to recent Boston appearances. Note he will be returning in the fall.

results.description:
Hi everybody and welcome to another edition of the Manga Club! I hope you’re ready for a change of pace, because it’s time to move beyond the chaos of the bloody past and shifting futures towards something completely different!

Gender identity is a difficult topic at the best of times. Our ideas of what define gender are shaped by so many factors that it is sometimes difficult to quantify what it is in the first place. Manga is known for pushing certain boundaries in that topic, as we have already seen (*cough* Ranma ½ *cough*) and they have been known to treat it in some rather interesting ways.

Therefore! This month, we shall be returning to a comparison format by looking at two titles which uniquely address this issue. One will show us an alternate history shaped by a major societal shift, while the other addresses our current day to day reality and how such decisions are reflected within it. I am talking about Ooku: The inner Chambers volume 1 by Fumi Yoshinaga and Wandering Son volume 1 by Shimura Takako!

Ooku: The inner Chambers volume 1 by Fumi Yoshinaga

In Edo period Japan, a strange new disease called the Red Pox has begun to prey on the country's men. Within eighty years of the first outbreak, the male population has fallen by seventy-five percent. Women have taken on all the roles traditionally granted to men, even that of the Shogun. The men, precious providers of life, are carefully protected. And the most beautiful of the men are sent to serve in the Shogun's Inner Chambers.

Wandering Son Book 1 by Shimura Takako

The fifth grade. The threshold to puberty, and the beginning of the end of childhood innocence. Shuichi Nitori and his new friend Yoshino Takatsuki have happy homes, loving families, and are well-liked by their classmates. But they share a secret that further complicates a time of life that is awkward for anyone: Shuichi is a boy who wants to be a girl, and Yoshino is a girl who wants to be a boy. Written and drawn by one of today’s most critically acclaimed creators of manga, Shimura portrays Shuishi and Yoshino’s very private journey with affection, sensitivity, gentle humor, and unmistakable flair and grace. Book One introduces our two protagonists and the friends and family whose lives intersect with their own. Yoshino is rudely reminded of her sex by immature boys whose budding interest in girls takes clumsily cruel forms. Shuichi’s secret is discovered by Saori, a perceptive and eccentric classmate. And it is Saori who suggests that the fifth graders put on a production of The Rose of Versailles for the farewell ceremony for the sixth graders — with boys playing the roles of women, and girls playing the roles of men

Both titles are available from our venue for purchase, and copies can also be found in the library.
Hope to see you soon!
results.name: June Manga Club! A Change Of Perspective!

results.description:
(Please note: many of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending that it says on the Meetup site.)

About This Meditation Meetup

We sit in silence for around 45 minutes, followed by discussion for around 30 minutes or so. The silent sitting is interspersed with some meditation instruction, perhaps a brief reading, a little simple inquiry, exploration or movement. Sitting posture is relaxed, either on a meditation cushion or a bench. It's not a rigid practice- move whenever you need to!

We meet every Monday night, 7:30 pm at the Cambridge Friends Meeting House. The Friends Meeting House is located at 5 Longfellow Park, Cambridge, MA 02138 You can find a very good map here: <a href="http://www.fmcquaker.org/FMC-Map_2006.pdf" target="_blank"></a>

http://fmcquaker.org/about-friends-meeting-at-cambridge/directions/

Parking is available after 6:00 in the loop off of Brattle St. that leads to the Friend's House, and there is a small lot in back of the Friend's House for those with limited mobility. After that, parking is a little tricky in Cambridge (lots of "resident only" signs), but you will find available parking on Mount Auburn St. near Friend's House and on Brattle St. as you head away from Harvard Square.

Coming by the T is a great option, with the Friend's House being a lovely 15 minute walk out of Harvard Square.

If you find you are running late, come anyway! The format is very relaxed and open— anyone interested in contemplative practice is welcome!

 

About Open Awareness Meditation Group

At the heart of these meditation sessions is the silent exploration of what we refer to as Open Awareness. We all know what it means to feel closed, limited, vulnerable, or separate. What is it like to allow ourselves to return to our natural condition of openness, presence, non-separateness and ease? This is what we explore in our meetings.

We have been meeting for over a decade, and those who lead the meditations have known each other and been practicing together for many years. They have all deeply explored a variety of traditions— for some it has been the Tibetan Buddhist practices of Dzogchen or Mahamudra, for others it has been the Indian traditions of Yoga, or Advaita, or what is currently referred to as Nonduality (some popular examples of this are Francis Lucille, Rupert Spira, Eckhart Tolle and Adyashanti). 

However all of these traditions ultimately point to the same truth, the truth of our basic awareness or presence which is beyond any tradition, practice or teaching. This is the presence we share, and the presence we are, beyond words. This is what we explore in our meetings.

This group is unique in that there is no specific guiding teacher, lama, or guru. We all meet as equals to question, share, and inspire each other to explore the Open Awareness we most deeply are. The meetings are suitable for newcomers as well as experienced meditators, and all are very welcome.
results.name: Open Awareness Meditation Group Meetup

Sign-up for the Webinar at: https://www.innerengineering.com/online/free-meditation-webinars-2?signinsrc=Meetup-NewEngland

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email. 

(Technical Support:[masked]) 


Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

THIS IS A WEB CONFERENCE ONLY.  TIME OF WEB CONFERENCE LOCALLY IS BASED ON LIVE-STREAM START - PACIFIC DAYLIGHT TIME. DETAILS TO CONNECT TO LIVE-STREAM ARE INDICATED BELOW. 

Apache Spark is an open source processing engine built around speed, ease of use, and analytics. If you have large amounts of data that requires low latency processing that a typical Map Reduce program cannot provide, Spark is the alternative.

Spark performs at speeds up to 100 times faster than Map Reduce for iterative algorithms or interactive data mining. Spark provides in-memory cluster computing for lightning fast speed and supports Java, Scala, and Python APIs for ease of development. Spark allows data scientists to build models quickly and supports iterative jobs on distributed datasets. This means more people can apply deep intelligence into applications to make everything smarter, including the Internet of Things (IoT), machine learning, web, mobile, social, business process and more. 

Do you believe in the value of Spark, in the speed, efficiency and flexibility of this in-memory compute engine? IBM does.  Emphatically.That's why we're committed to do everything we can to accelerate the adoption of Spark for enterprise analytics, where Spark promises seemingly unlimited value.

On June 15, 2015, IBM will host a Spark Community event in San Francisco, California: IBM | Spark - The Start of Something Big in Data and Design. There will be a live demo showcase, refreshments, and a Town Hall discussion featuring some of the most trail-blazing data scientists in today's Spark Community, including:

•  Edd Dumbill, VP Strategy, Silicon Valley Data Science
•  Mike Tamir, Chief Science Officer & VP of Data Science & Education at Galvanize
•   Fernando Perez, Staff Scientist at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory & Founding Investigator of the Berkeley Institute for Data Science
•   Haoyuan Li, CEO and Founder of Tachyon Nexus
•   Shankar Venkataraman, Distinguished Engineer & CTO, IBM Analytics Platform at IBM
•   Paco Nathan, Director, Community Evangelism, Databricks

Spark Community members will also deliver 5-minute lightning talks to describe exciting projects they're working on.

We will provide a livestream presentation of what these Spark leaders have to say.

Live Streaming Link:

To get additional details about Spark you can sign up now for a reminder at:

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Scroll down to "Can't attend in Person"?  Sign up for a reminder and add it to your calendar.

Additional information on Spark:

Link to Spark Fundamentals Course in Big Data University

http://bigdatauniversity.com/bdu-wp/bdu-course/spark-fundamentals/

Link to Spark Technology Information

http://www.ibm.com/analytics/us/en/technology/spark/

Happy Sparking.

results.description:
Join us for our business networking event. The agenda is:

7:00-7:20 open networking

7:20-7:40 introductions and commercials (your elevator pitch)

7:40-8:20 two ten minute presentations from members of the group about their business.

8:20-on open networking.

Our focus is on building relationships with the members, not just seeing them once or twice at a random event and never following up.  We also focus on giving the others in the room the information they need in order to refer to you and vice versa.
results.how_to_find_us: The entrance is on the right side of the library (cleveland street).  When you come in, take a right down the stairs.
results.name: MVC Business Networking Event

results.description:
9:00 am - Introduction to Day 2 

9:15 am - Google Tools technical workshop - Padmaja Surendranath BI Instructor, Logi Analytics

Tired of sharing your google docs on google spreadsheets. Come learn how to build a simple dashboard using Google. Along the way you will learn how to create charts using your data, how merge different datasets and in general, make your data analysis easier  - all using Google tools. 


Padmaja offers professional development courses/workshops on data management and leads the design and implementation of Learning Analytics projects Through her consulting agency, Edventor Inc.

Required: A laptop that can run Google Drive & a Google account. No prior programming skills needed. Basic Excel skills might be helpful

10:15 am - Emotional Measurement Lab - Garron 


In this lab we will review the state of research and technology for emotional measurement in learning analytics. 1) Briefly discuss the Measuring and Understanding Learner Emotions: Evidence and Prospects produced by the Learning Analytics Community Exchange (LACE).  2)Briefly talk about <a>The neurobiology of emotion–cognition interactions: fundamental questions and strategies for future research</a> from the open journal Frontiers. 3) Review a variety of technologies for measuring emotion and discuss the various strengths and challenges providing code snippets to interface with APIs and conduct sentiment analysis referencing challenges in measure non-cognitive skills outlined in Measurement Matters: Assessing Personal Qualities Other Than Cognitive Ability for Educational Purposes.

Looking at Eyeris - https://www.mashape.com/eyeris/emovu-1

Example of NLP used from - https://github.com/amueller/odscon-2015

resources about cross validation

For Scikit learn cross validation documentation seehttp://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/cross_validation.html

See pages[masked] to understand more about cross validating the datahttp://web.stanford.edu/~hastie/local.ftp/Springer/OLD/ESLII_print4.pdf

11:00 am - Lightning Talks (unconference style - attendees can share out what they are doing here.  Just talk to Garron on Day 1 or at the beginning of Day 2 to participate)

11:15 am - Python for Educational Data Mining and Learning Analytics - Al Essa & Shirin Mojarad

12:15 pm - Break for Lunch 

1:15 pm - BYOS/R - Bring Your Own Simulation and Rubric - Rapid development of auto-scored authentic performance tasks - Doug Stein CTO, metacog

2:00 pm - Panel discussion on Learning Analytics in the wild! - Chair Skip Stahl, Michael Connell
results.name: Learning Analytics Summer Institute '15 Boston - Day 2

This week we are meeting at Pratt's Brook in Acton. There are some minor ups and downs that kids usually find fun. There's also a wild blueberry patch!


We meet Tuesdays at 10a at various hiking trails in the metrowest area. The hikes are suited for caregivers who carry their children (usually up to 2 y/o) and for young children who walk/run. No stroller hikes unless specified in the details of the hike. Please dress appropriately for the weather and terrain with layers, appropriate footwear and water.


Questions? Or to get more information on the weekly hikes please email...

Bring a friend and see you there!

Emily

Set yourself up for a feel-good afternoon as you breathe, stretch, and strengthen in this 45-minute, all-levels Vinyasa practice. Flow into the rest of your day with renewed physical and mental energy! All levels are welcome!

results.description:
Hi Writers & Authors,

No matter where you are in the Writing Process … (Brainstorm, Draft, Revise, Edit, Final Draft and Publish) having a place to go and people to support you is key

From other writers we learn to write better and get feedback Writing is reading other people’s work for comparison and contrast Writers' groups can be very useful to writers.  They can provide quality feedback, which is something that can sometimes be difficult for writers.  Writers can also provide motivation as other writers can encourage you to keep writing and finally finish that novel or short story.

This reorganized group may be for you if you seek a meetup that provides a supportive community where writers can polish their manuscripts; improve their craft, share information, and gain confidence in pursuing their publishing goals.
results.how_to_find_us: Roche Bros. Community Room
results.name: Writer's Meet & Greet- Get Support & Feedback

results.description:
Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: Clarendon street entrance. Ask the desk attendant for directions to room.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Hillview Golf Course Pro Chris Carter has offered us 4 tee times at 5:15 pm starting the first week in May through the end of August.    I will post this weekly during the season and accept 16 members plus a waitlist.    The 9 hole fee is $21 and golf carts are $8, although this is a very walkable course.  If for any reason you need to cancel out, please do so 24 hours ahead of time. This  allows the  waitlist members  time to fill your spot. 


The HIllview Pro shop does  handicaps for members who would like this.You can post your score at HIllview Pro shop or online for $50 for the season.   Hillview offers lessons for those interested as well a  driving range.  I will make plans at a local restaurant for the "19th" hole and update later.

Please check out the website for further information at http://www.hillviewgc.com

UPDATE: .After a meeting of our Board, and in consideration of our ASGA members,  it was decided to  open this event  to official ASGA members initially, then to meetup members.  ASGA members pay $79 a year for membership.  Any non-ASGA members will incur a surcharge of $5 each week, payable before you golf for that day.  Any non-ASGA member  may become a member by going to www.singlesgolf.com and click 'join' thereby avoiding the surcharge.

Any questions, please contact me by clicking on my profile and then the word 'message' in order to send a private email.
results.how_to_find_us: Please arrive 15-30 min before tee off time, pay greens fee, sign in and be prepared to tee off at 5:15

results.description:
ME AND EARL AND THE DYING GIRL
Synopsis:

Winner of the Grand Jury Prize and the Audience Award at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival, ME AND EARL AND THE DYING GIRL is the uniquely funny, moving story of Greg (Thomas Mann), a high school senior who is trying to blend in anonymously, avoiding deeper relationships as a survival strategy for navigating the social minefield that is teenage life. He even describes his constant companion Earl (RJ Cyler), with whom he makes short film parodies of classic movies, as more of a 'co-worker’ than a best friend. But when Greg’s mom (Connie Britton) insists he spend time with Rachel (Olivia Cooke) – a girl in his class who has just been diagnosed with cancer - he slowly discovers how worthwhile the true bonds of friendship https://youtu.be/2qfmAllbYC8
results.name: Me Earl and the Dying Girl  6-16  Tue.   Kendall Sq.  7 PM

results.description:
Tonight we will be joined by guest speakers and co-authors Chris Michaud & John Agostinelli.  Chris and John will be speaking about their newly released book on "The Great Housing Recession" which focuses on the fundamental reasons for the last housing recession.  More Specifically:

1.  What the major causes of the last housing recession were

2.  Where we are in the real estate market cycle now, how far away we are from another housing recession & ways that you can protect yourself from the next downturn

3.  The long term impacts of the last real estate recession including the impact that it will have on taxpayers

This is an open invitation with no fees, and all that we ask is that you rsvp on our page prior to the event.

Environment: We will have an informal environment, including food and refreshments fully catered by Polcari's Italian Restaurant . The educational portion of the event will begin at approximately 6:15pm. Please come ready to network and mingle with other individuals in the real estate industry.

Time and Structure of Event: the event starts at 5:00pm, but feel free to come anywhere between 5:00- 7:00pm. You will be able to go in and out at your convenience.

Attendees: typical attendees usually consist of other real estate investors, wholesalers, hard money lenders and brokers, real estate agents, real estate attorney's, real estate accountants, contractors and anyone looking to get into the real estate business.

Please register for the event at www.oceancitymeetup.com

Facebook: www.oceancityfacebookpage.com

Youtube: www.oceancitychannel.com

Linkedin: www.tinyurl.com/oceancitylinkedin
results.name: The Great Housing Recession w/ Chris Michaud & John Agostinelli

results.description:
Important practical details: Please navigate to our registration to fully sign up for the event. Just RSVPing does not fully register you for this event. Those who do not register through this link before 8 pm on 6/15 will be charged the full $40 at the door. Please note that because this event is marketed in other places, more attendees will likely be showing up than the number of RSVPs

Please register here.

Location: Please note that the address has been recently updated from 1 Cambridge Ctr to 255 Main St. Cambridge MA as the street has been renamed by the city. Please refer to the picture at the bottom of this email that shows the venue for further clarification.

Health Innovators has arranged an exciting event in which a panel of four speakers will will share their thoughts on how primary care will improve in the future through better care coordination. Learn what issues exist in the system currently, and how innovators are addressing the need for improved communication amongst clinicians needed to take care of patients.

Join us for healthy refreshments, including sandwiches, energy bars, and nonalcoholic drinks.

Price: $30 until June 15th at 8:00 pm; $40 after then.  Sign up at 
http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?oeidk=a07eb0liqoaf26f045e&llr=acqgfvqab&__hstc=37050943.82abc6c1930d5412257b3d14dd4cf3a1.1429238098222.1434072527107.1434075001748.45&__hs...

Free for full time college students through Stay in MA - please apply at http://www.stayinma.com/apply to attend at no charge. 

Place: Microsoft Corporate Center; 1 Cambridge Ctr.; Cambridge, MA

Agenda (times are approximate):  
Open Networking - 5:30 pm to 6:15 pm 
Program - 6:15 pm to 8:15 pm 
Open Networking - 8:15 pm to 8:45 pm

Speakers:

Michael J. Doyle, FACHE - President & CEO, QPID Health 
Mike Doyle has a long track record of vision, leadership and team-building, as well as an exemplary record of creating business value in investor-backed, rapid-growth, public and private healthcare and technology companies. Prior to joining QPID, Doyle was CEO and Chairman of Medsphere Systems Corporation, developer of OpenVista, an open-source enterprise Electronic Health Record. While President and CEO of Advantedge Health Solutions, he led the rapid expansion of a hosted physician revenue cycle management solution for hospital-based physicians. As founder, CEO and President of Standish Care (CareMatrix), he was instrumental in creating the “assisted living” category. Earlier in his career he held senior leadership positions with two major integrated healthcare delivery systems: Voluntary Hospitals of America (VHA) and National Medical Enterprises (Tenet). He started his career in hospital strategy and operations at Norwood Hospital/Neponsett Valley Health System. Doyle is a Fellow in the American College of Healthcare Executives. He also holds a BS from Tufts University and a MBA from the University of Chicago in Hospital Administration and Finance where he was a Kaiser Fellow. He has been featured in many local and national publications and television programs and is a frequent speaker at healthcare industry events.

Piali De - CEO, Senscio Systems

Piali De is a co-founder and CEO of Senscio Systems, a technology company whose mission is to create sensors and decision support systems that help people bridge the gap between sensing and deciding. Senscio Systems’ vision is to be a leader in developing systems that automatically make sense of data to support informed decision-making. Senscio Systems’ first product is a chronic care management system called Ibis, designed to improve self care and enable early intervention to avoid complications of chronic illnesses such as diabetes, pulmonary disease and heart disease. </a>

<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=58275950&authType=NAME_SEARCH&authToken=UtkW&locale=en_US&srchid=504739931432912453406&srchindex=2&srchtotal=4256&trk=vsrp_people_res_name&trkInfo=VSRPsearchId%3A504739931432912453406%2CVSRPtargetId%3A58275950%2CVSRPcmpt%3Aprimary%2CVSRPnm%3Atrue&__hstc=37050943.82abc6c1930d5412257b3d14dd4cf3a1.1429238098222.1432913866901.1432918084814.24&__hssc=37050943.3.1432918084814&__hsfp=2958602349">John Moore - CEO, Twine Health 
John Moore is a physician and technologist passionate about empowering patients to take the lead in their care. He is the CEO of Twine Health, a startup focused on improving the experience, clinical outcomes, and costs of healthcare.

Moore received a PhD from the MIT Media Lab where he developed and studied technology-supported apprenticeship as a new paradigm of patient-clinician collaboration. He received both an MD and a BS in biomedical engineering from Boston University.

David Lebudzinski, M.D. - iGetBetter 
David Lebudzinski, M.D. began working with the iGetBetter project as a consulting physician in early 2012. David received his undergraduate degree from the College of the Holy Cross with a major in physics. He subsequently received his medical degree from the University of Massachusetts in Worcester and completed his internship in Internal Medicine at UMass followed by additional training in Diagnostic Radiology. David departed from traditional clinical medicine in 1999 to offer personalized patient medical education. Dr. Lebudzinski is officially retired from formal clinical practice. He provides general clinical guidance to iGetBetter and acts as a liaison with active clinicians who approve and assign the care plans for their patients. He also provides personalized medical education and guidance to individuals/patients frustrated with the current medical system. 

About the Health Innovators: Health Innovators supports healthcare innovation in the Greater Boston community through collaboration and education opportunities. The group welcomes anyone interested in exploring the healthcare industry, and caters to small business owners, entrepreneurs, and consultants. Please learn more about Health Innovators at http://www.healthinno.com

Dope in Boston
June 19, 2015 (2 weeks and 4 days away)
Comedy, Drama

Director
Rick Famuyiwa
Writer
Rick Famuyiwa
Actors
Zoë Kravitz, Kiersey Clemons, Forest Whitaker, Keith Stanfield

A coming of age comedy/drama for the post hip hop generation. Malcolm is a geek, carefully surviving life in The Bottoms, a tough neighborhood in Inglewood, CA filled gangsters and drugs dealers, while juggling his senior year of college applications, interviews and the SAT. His dream is to attend Harvard. A chance invitation to a big underground party leads Malcolm and his friends into a, only in Los Angeles, gritty adventure filed with offbeat characters and bad choices. If Malcolm can persevere, he'll go from being a geek, to being dope, to ultimately being himself.


https://youtu.be/3ViVPRWRRmk

results.description:
$10 to attend. Please BE ON TIME.


Please bring at least six copies of ONE of the following:

1. Ten pages of an original feature screenplay (or a ten or less-page short film) that you wrote yourself.
2. A treatment that you wrote yourself (one to two-page synopsis of the plot) for a proposed original screenplay. Please keep treatments to two pages maximum.


Time permitting, we'll workshop whatever you bring. The amount of time we spend per work depends on how many screenwriters come by. If you haven't written a script or treatment, then come with your questions and a willingness to provide constructive feedback for others.

Regardless of what you bring, be sure to PRINT OUT COPIES so that we can read it together. If you don't print them out, we'll have no way to workshop your work! The number of copies necessary will depend on the total in attendance, so check back here close to the event for an estimated number. Printing out at least enough for two people to share would be appreciated!

If you haven't written a screenplay or treatment but are curious about the process, then we definitely have a place for you. For beginners, we highly recommend grabbing a copy of The Complete Screenwriter's Manual (http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Screenwriters-Manual-Comprehensive-Reference/dp/0321397932) and screenwriting software (free: CeltX.com, more features: FinalDraft.com)

For more personalized script attention, I offer one-on-one screenplay coverage services. Details and testimonials: http://www.screenplay.guru. 10% off for Cambridge Screenwriting members.

We can't wait to see you!
results.name: Group Screenplay Workshop - $10

results.description:
In an effort to ride more than once a week, I'm adding weekly tuesday rides to the schedule. This week we will try out Hales Reservation. All levels welcome. I have only been here once but from what I remember it's pretty flowly.

From NEMBA: The trails at Hale seem almost contradictory. On the one hand you can cruise around on the marked loops and enjoy a peaceful, scenic ride. Venture onto the many unmarked singletracks and you will subject yourself to some pretty extreme and difficult trails.
results.name: Ride Hale Reservation.

results.description:
Greetings South Shore Web Developers. Some of you may know me, some may not. My name is Matt Ulvila and i'm co-founder of 3thought. We're a small design/development shop in Plymouth MA. We've been looking to have a night where south shore web workers can gather, have a few drinks. A no pressure evening out with like minded people. No pitches, no talks, just conversation over some adult beverages and the start of some new friendships.

Here's the details.

Meetup Date: The 3rd Tuesday of the Month

Location: BBC in Pembroke MA

Time: 6-8pm

The manager has a spot for us in the back of the restaurant. Depending on group size and where everyone is coming from, we can look into modifying times/places etc., but for now this how it will work.

And... I would love if you could please help me spread the word about the group. It's free for you to tweet or post a link to linkedin/facebook, and would really mean a lot if you could help.

Looking forward to meeting you all next week.

cheers

-matt
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the back. I'm the bald guy with the dark beer.
results.name: South Shore Web Developers and Designers Unite.

results.description:
From fitness bands to ingestible sensors, sensor tech has the potential to drastically change our daily lives. Well known consumer technology companies such as Fitbit and Jawbone help wearers keep track of their daily activity, sensors built into watches by Apple and Samsung can measure heart rate throughout the day, and pioneers in digestible sensors such as Proteus Digital Health are developing systems that can track health with metrics from within the body. Companies such as MC10 are pushing the limits of wearables by developing the Biostamp, a sensor that can measure temperature, movement, heart rate, and more within a device that is the size of two postage stamps. As these devices become more ubiquitous, the "connected human" will not only be able to monitor health metrics about him/herself in real-time, but also be able to share that data with healthcare professionals and other individuals. How will we adapt to this fast-approaching reality and what challenges remain to utilize this technology for improving human health?

Registration is free at http://bostonbiotech.org/upcoming-events/

Our speakers are Michael Cima (Co-founder of MicroCHIPS), Shahid Azim (CEO of Quanttus), Mandira Singh (Senior Business Developer Athena Health), Ben Schlatka (Co-founder MC10), and Lesley Solomon (Executive Director of Innovation Hub at Brigham and Women's).
results.name: Big Data Gets Personal: Transforming Healthcare in the Age of Wearable Tech

results.description:
I love this little shop in Newburyport! They offer all sorts of essential oils, bath and body products and I love the oatmeal soap with shea butter,  since using it my skin is so soft, and the oatmeal helps exfoliate my skin

So come join us while we learn to make our own body scrubs using items we have in our home that help soften and rejuvenate our skin.  You can even make your own essential oil body scent.

Refreshments will be served while we listen and learn how to make scrubs and potions perfect for all our skins needs. 

Body Sense is the leader in custom blending unscented bath & body products. We take pride in our wide selection of natural & organic products.

Body Sense has been a local store in Newburyport Massachusetts for over 40 years. We carry an array of beauty and spa products along with designer fragrances in oil form. We specialize in the custom blending of bath & body products with natural and organic essential oils and fragrant oils.

The store is very small and this event is liimited to 10 people , so please only RSVP if you plan on attending.

We did this event early last fall and it was great and we had so much fun and brought home some fabulous skincare products.

www.bodysense.biz/home.html

The Right Body Care Makes Perfect Body Sense! The shop went over a remodel during the winter, so much more streamlined.

Lisa and Dawn -- the experts !!!

Making our own facial scrubs .. came out fabulous

Hmm, very interesting, what's going on here ?
results.name: Body Sense-Newburyport- Let's make our own scrubs & essential oil body scent

results.description:
Door to the Outdoors presents an author talk and book signing with journalist, media producer, and author - JAMES EDWARD MILLS.

James Edward Mills’ book "The Adventure Gap: Changing the Face of the Outdoors" chronicles the first-ever all African-American summit attempt on Alaska’s Mt. Denali. He uses Expedition Denali and its team members’ adventures as a jumping-off point to explore how minority populations view their place in wild environments and share the stories of those who have already achieved significant accomplishments in outdoor adventures. The goal of the expedition, and now the book, is to inspire minority communities to look outdoors for experiences that will enrich their lives, and encourage them toward greater environmental stewardship. In this book, he creates a compelling case for all Americans to embrace their place in the great outdoors. 

The event is FREE and OPEN to all.
results.name: Author Discussion & Book Signing: The Adventure Gap by James Edward Mills

HISTORIC HOUSE TOUR Tuesday, June 16th from 6:00PM to 7:30pm


SIGNATURE EVENT SERIES – registration required

The historic tour of Willowdale Estate covers historic background, context and conversation about the Arts & Crafts style mansion. Learn the details and hear the fascinating stories of our wonderful and unique estate as lead by a member of our educated staff. Join us for delicious refreshments and conversation after the tour.

Willowdale Estate is over one hundred years old and although most of our public rooms are accessible to guests with limited mobility there is a small portion of the tour that features upstairs guest rooms of the estate which could make access difficult in the upper rooms of the home.  Comfortable seating and accommodation will be provided for those who do not wish to or cannot travel to the upper rooms.

There is no cost posted at this time, but there may be a fee.  We'll see on the 24th.


Registration begins on May 24th! 


http://willowdaleestate.com/signature-events/

Pitch your startup to a friendly audience and get feedback from experts. Win prizes. You get 90 seconds. Only catch? NO decks. Hone your message - while "flying without a deck."


Christina Inge, Founder of ThoughtLight and CEO of Sleek Marketing University, www.sleekmarketingu.com . Twitter: @christinainge, LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/in/christinainge Christina is a marketing consultant with over 20 years experience in content creation, web technologies, and project management. She is adept at finding creative ways to maximize the small marketing budgets of startups and nonprofits by using web-based, cost-effective methods. Her areas of expertise include the design of social media marketing campaigns that boost brand recognition and affiliation. Through best practices SEO, she teaches methods that enhance click-through experiences, improve conversion rates and increase organic search rankings. She helps companies with product go-to-market plans, email marketing strategy and implementation, online lead conversion and lead generation analysis and optimization, and product positioning.

Through Sleek Marketing University she teaches the latest digital marketing techniques to help startups, small businesses, and nonprofits reach new audiences cost-effectively. Subjects addressed include SEO, Google Analytics, social media, marketing automation and many others.


Price: $10 for non-ENET members, free for ENET members. Free Pizza and soft drinks will be served. Advanced registration is requested

results.description: Come dragon boat with Living Root! We're a co-ed team and we're always looking for new paddlers to join us. This is a great way to get in shape, meet people, and do something fun and competitive.  We meet at 6pm at the docks behind the Barking Crab (88 Sleeper Street in Boston), a short walk from South Station.  We paddle rain or shine, so dress for the weather.  Bring a bottle of water, and we'll provide all the paddling equipment you'll need and a place to lock up your belongings.  We often head out for a quick bite to eat after practice, and you're welcome to join us.  Send questions to: Dave Parker at [masked]. Check out our website or find us on Facebook!

results.description:
Limited to 30: You must also register with hunts

The Art and Craft of Landscape and Nature Photography with Ossian Lindholm

Do you enjoy photography and travel? Come enjoy a FREE and exclusive photo presentation at Hunts Camera & Video on how to capture stunning travel photographs while learning about the spectacular landscape, culture and nature of Argentina by the renowned Argentinian landscape photographer and documentary filmmaker Ossian Lindholm. At this inspiring and educational presentation, native Argentinian photographer Ossian Lindholm will teach us the art (and craft) of creating magical landscape photographs as he takes us on an intimate visual journey of his favorite Argentinian places.

He will teach us about saturating a photo with color while introducing us to rainbow hued mountain range in the Andes. We’ll learn about how to best frame the full moon’s special light as it rises over a cactus forest or what shutter speed and lens to use when snapping soaring condors. We’ll take a visual and sensory stroll through the world’s highest vineyard and learn how to compose water drops on grapes or what is the best aperture setting to creatively capture Las Salinas Grandes, a vast and brightly lit salt desert at over 10,000 feet.

Space is limited, so please sign up today
results.name: The Art and Craft of Landscape and Nature Photography with Ossian Lindholm

results.description:
Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth. Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity." If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker! It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit <a>www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.</a>

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up. Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

$25 at the door (if tickets available)

$15 pre-paid RSVP *(Limited to 25 male/ 25 female tickets)

early bird special: First 10 to use promocode "earlybird" save $5 off the prepaid price (pay $10 instead of $15).

prepay at THIS LINK

results.description:
Does your company or product team need to increase the speed of delivery? Do you want to reduce costs while optimizing flow of work? Do you need to gain control and understanding of your work flowing from the idea to the delivery? Then Value Stream Mapping is something you want to learn about. In this seminar, you will learn what Value Stream Mapping is and how it can help you. Value Stream Mapping will help you visualize the big picture of your work-flow and focus you on how you can achieve process improvements that reduce lead times and increase productivity and quality output.

The benefits for you attending this session include:

+ You will learn what is Value Stream Mapping (VSM).

+ You will realize the importance of visualizing the flow of work from idea to delivery.

+ You will gain insight on how a Value Stream Mapping session is implemented.

+ You will gain insight into how VSM can help your team optimize the flow of the work, reduce waste, and deliver faster.

About the speaker:

Mario E. Moreira is a VP of Client Engagement and Agile Consultant with Emergn Ltd.  His specialty is helping companies gain the business benefits of Agile leading to a company's success.  He does this by increasing value of their products, optimizing flow for faster delivery, and increasing quality through fast customer feedback. He is a certified Scrum Master (CSM), a certified Scrum Professional (CSP), and a Value Flow Quality (VFQ) educator, coach, and consultant.  He has Scrum, XP, and Kanban experience in enterprise-level Agile transformations, coaching, and team-building. In the past, he has served as VP of Engineering at Fidelity Investments and the Head of the Agile Transformation at CA (Computer Associates). 

Networking over pizza and refreshments at 6pm.  Presentation begins at 7pm.
results.how_to_find_us: Please visit http:\/\/boston-spin.org for directions.  Location Change: We will be meeting this month in Building C, Also known as the MITRE Center.
results.name: Value Stream Mapping - Optimize your flow, reduce waste, and deliver faster

Free event! Come learn about 5 innovative and exciting technology products and network with the Boston/Cambridge startup community!  Each presenter gets 5 minutes for product demonstration and 5 minutes for Q&A.  Please follow @BostonNewTech and use the #BNT54 hashtag in social media posts: details here.


Sponsors:

Foley Hoag LLP - No industry moves faster or makes a bigger impact on the way we live than the technology industry. Technology innovators in software, hardware, gaming, entertainment and telecom turn to Foley Hoag LLP to help secure and maintain their leadership positions in this competitive industry. Our attorneys provide a comprehensive array of legal services for companies in all stages of development, from conception through profitability and beyond. For more information, please click here to visit our website for technology entrepreneurs. Follow @FoleyHoag and like them on facebook. www.FoleyHoag.com [masked]

Built on the foundation of Yodlee’s 15 years of aggregated consumer financial data, Yodlee Interactive empowers visionary entrepreneurs, partners, and developers to build the next generation  of disruptive and innovative Fintech solutions using the award-winning Yodlee platform. Through our APIs, we help you bring innovative FinApps to market more quickly using the richest consumer transactional data in the world.

Register for 30 day access. For more information on using our APIs for your FinTech startup click here.

Products & Presenters:


1. KlioCarePlan - Helping manage complex care patients through care transitions & self-care tools (Anshuman Sharm / @anshumansharma) Tech: Python, AngularJS, Redis, CouchDB, ElasticSearch. kliocareplan.com


2. GemShelf / @GemShelf - A Knowledge Management tool that helps groups capture, organize and share info (Colin Kennedy) Tech: Meteor, MongoDB, AWS, Postgres, Lucene. gemshelf.com


3. Yoke / @lambdazen - Track your cloud apps (Sridhar Ramachandran) Tech: ConceptJS, Java 8 with Nashhorn, Cassandra, Elastic Search, AWS. yoke.io


4. Tabshare   / @tabshareapp - Mobile ordering, payment, and marketing platform for bars and nightclubs. (Ian de Vries / @WIdeVries) Tech: Database: MySQL, Back-end: PHP, Front-end: iOS. tabshare-app.com

5. LetsAllDoGood app (iOS) - @letsall_dogood<a> </a>- All the good in the world.  In the palm of your hand. (Greg McHale) Tech: iOS. letsalldogood.launchrock.com

Agenda:


6:00 to 7:00 - Networking with dinner and drinks

7:00 to 7:10 - Announcements

7:10 to 8:30 - Presentations, Q&A

8:30 to 9:00 - More Networking

9:00 - More networking over drinks across the street, at The Whiskey Priest, 150 Northern Ave. (at Seaport Blvd.), Boston, MA. (optional)

Directions & Parking:


Foley Hoag is in the Seaport West building. Take an elevator to the 13th floor and look for signs. Please do not check in with security in the lobby.


Check in at our table just outside the meeting hall by typing your last name to print your name badge.

Public Transportation:

Foley Hoag is in the Seaport West building, right next to the MBTA Silver line World Trade Center Station. Walk 1 block north on World Trade Center Ave and you will see the building on your left. You can also walk there in 15 minutes from the MBTA Red line South Station. 

Driving directions:

Use this https://maps.google.com/maps?ie%3DUTF8%26f%3Dd%26daddr%3DFoley%2BHoag%2BLLP,%2B155%2BSeaport%2BBlvd,%2BBoston,%2BMA%2B02210%26geocode%3DCZyPbW7oCbXSFWU1hgIdWfjD-yG1hpFfpE6UFg%26gl%3DUS%26hl%3Den">Google Map. There are parking meters along Congress St, Seaport Blvd, E Service Rd and Boston Wharf Rd and two open-air parking lots just east of the building (along E Service Rd), which charge $14-15 for the evening.

results.description:
ExtensionEngine will host a presentation on the Open edX platform, followed by a discussion and individual workshop (time permitting). We will go through some of the ins and outs of creating an engaging course, conducting assessments, capturing and analyzing the data and showcase examples of current offerings built on the Open edX platform.


Topics we plan to address include:

• What is Open edX and how is it related to edx.org?

• What can you do with Open edX?

• What are some examples of how Open edX is used?

• What is typical timing and budget to launch an online learning program with Open edX?

• How does Open edX compare to alternative solutions?

• What is the Open edX roadmap and plans for the future?

• How can I learn more about Open edX?
results.name: The Open edX Platform - How it Works

results.description:
We are here to help those who have experienced separation or divorce. Our facilitators have personally experienced a divorce and through attending a DivorceCare ministry have healed and want to help you start your healing. DivorceCare is both a seminar and a support group.

 

Whether you have been separated 1 day, or divorced for more than 25 years, this is a safe place to start your healing.

Here are just a few of the topics that we'll cover over the 14 sessions.

* What's happening to me?

* Facing my Anger, Loneliness

* Financial survival, Relationships

* Kidcare

 

Please come in on any week.The sessions are designed for you to start up whenever you need us. There is no need to wait until the beginning of a new season. Start now, you'll be glad that you did.


Come and discover help and healing with others who understand what you are experiencing.

Around 15-20 of us meet on Tuesdays from 6:30- 8:30 pm at Crossroads Community Church located at 1341 Edgell Road in Framingham.

The DivorceCare material is based on a Christian perspective, though people of all faiths and no faith participate in this program.

DivorceCare is NOT a dating environment.

Call or e-mail with any questions: David or Debbie Hartman: (508)[masked] // Email David or Debbie at <a>[masked]</a>

See our church's website http://CrossCommChurch.org

Sponsored by Crossroads Community Church
results.name: DivorceCare Meetup: Last night for this session

Josephine Bolling McCall’s book uncovers the truth behind the murder of her father, a black man, in 1940s Lowndes County, Alabama. Celebrated journalist Callie Crossley, a producer of the Academy Award-winning documentary Eyes on the Prize, joins McCall to discuss her journey of discovery.
