results.description:
We start off chatting about our work, including setting goals for ourselves (which is entirely optional but super helpful!), and then we write. That's what it's all about. As simple as the idea is, it's amazing how much more you can get done simply by being in the presence of other writers at work. The baked goods don't hurt, either.


There is power for laptops, and some of us use pen and paper. Your choice! Bonus: there's no Internet access, so you can omit a huge distraction without even trying. And, although we are not a discussion group, there are many areas where people can go if they want to talk without being disruptive.

Please click here for detailed directions! The school can be a bit of a maze and I don't want anybody getting lost.
results.name: Quite Write: Writing Night!

results.description:
We have a new name, and a new run night for the new season! Formerly Team LUNA Chix Boston Run, we are now She Runs Boston! We meet every Tuesday at Athleta (92 Newbury Street) and will offer a 3 and a 4 mile loop around the esplanade. We have a no-drop policy, and welcome women of all paces and abilities, so you never have to worry about getting left behind. The staff at Athleta will securely hold your belongings for the duration of the run. We will try to start promptly at 6:30pm, so please arrive a few minutes early so that you can sign a waiver and introduce yourself to the group.

One more thing! We will have a post-run social on the last Tuesday of every month at a local bar. Everyone knows that you need to replace the carbs after a good run, right? Right!
results.name: run around the esplanade

results.description:
下午6点到晚上9点 - Kresge 209 for all Tuesdays in June 2015
677 Huntington Avenue, Kresge 209 (2nd floor) - for ALL of June

Fred (ZHOU Hanlin) and Justin Kwan host these friendly meetups (in Kresge 209).  Enter as you have long done; but instead, merely turn the other direction (to the right) in the stairway.

* Mandarin speakers want to practice English (and reduce their Chinese accents)?
* English speakers want to learn Mandarin?
* Nerdy Chinese folks want to bring friends and have a fun, FREE "outing" in Boston just talking with nerdy strangers in English or Mandarin?

We will continue with last week's theme of watching a television show, but this time we will watch an episode of a Chinese series called 愛情公寓 with a discussion afterward.

Schedule: 
Before 6:30 pm - free conversations - so arrive early - as early as 5:30 pm 
[masked] Introductions! A great chance to get to know each other. 
[masked] Presentation of 愛情公寓.
[masked] Discussion and free chat.
9.00 Dinner.


Our location this week is Kresge 209 in the most gracious and globally conscious Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, where health-conscious and energy-conscious building and curriculum modifications have been made. 
For FOUR of all five weeks in June (6/6 - 6/30), we'll be in Kresge 209.

All attendees need to register IN ADVANCE to get an HSPH building permission for the night.

E-Mail [masked] to register your intent AND sign YES on this meetup.

下午6点到晚上8点3

PLEASE (try to) request by 4 pm the day before the Tuesday evening event.

* Harvard Square to LMA is about 30 minutes on #66 bus or M2 Harvard bus
* Green Line E-Line comes to Brigham Circle, then walk BACK to crosswalk, then to the building
* Walking from the Orange Line takes about 5-10 minutes, via Tremont Street to Brigham Circle
* Walking from Brookline is about 10 minutes - via Huntington Avenue or Longwood Avenue
* MFA, NEU, Wentworth, and Colleges of the Fenway are adjacent - on or off Huntington Avenue
* Route 9 comes right into the area, via Brookline - passes Huntington Avenue D-line stop
* Street parking is FREE from 6 pm onward (but not always easy to find)

Show your CURRENT LOCAL ID to the HSPH Security Guard on duty, then walk UP the open indoor stairwell (follow signs to Kresge 209), then turn left as you're walking up the stairs, and straight ahead to Kresge 201 - room in the 'lefthand corner'.

E-Mail [masked]
for a building pass if you don't have a Harvard ID; we convene in Kresge 209; you will ask the HSPH security guard WHICH of the four rooms we're using that night, and where that is.


PLEASE plan to show up early so we can begin our 'bilingual introductions' on time, so our presenter can begin (and end) on time.
results.how_to_find_us: Show your CURRENT LOCAL ID to the HSPH Security Guard, then UP the open indoor stairwell (follow signs to Kresge 209)

results.description:
Spend some time on your project by bringing it along to our weekly project night, an evening designed around you and what you're working on.

This weekly event is about finding time to tinker, being creative, and meeting other members of the community.  You'll get the chance to see what others are working on, share your projects, and to get inspiration and feedback from fellow tinkerers.

On any given Tuesday night you have people working on electronics, knitting, writing code, wood-working, or just their plans for world domination. Beer is also consumed.

We’ll provide: space to work, basic tools, power, a room full of like minded people.

You’ll provide: your project, ideas and beer. A laptop would probably be useful too.

Sometimes we work on group projects together, which are usually set up as separate meetup events. Keep an eye on our events page to see what we’re working on next.

results.description:
Change of Location to Burlington Landlocked Forest


We will meet in the parking lot at 42 Turning Mill Rd and run the yellow blazed Landlocked Forest Loop. Terrain is quickly rolling, and the trail twists with switchbacks and curlicues. Surfaces are mostly hard packed-dirt and/or duff with only short segments of rougher or looser ground and some segments of boardwalk. Distance for the full Loop is about 4.5 miles; a shorter version may be an option.


Food and drink to follow at is always an option. Margaritas is nearby and Waxy's (Modern Irish Bar) is too.

For information on the Landlocked Forest,

http://landlockedforest.com/

For a map,

http://landlockedforest.com/BLLF_temp_map_4-3-14.pdf

<a href="http://www.meetup.com/Waltham-Trail-Runners/photos/686695/368314762/"></a>
results.name: Change of Location to Burlington Landlocked Forest

results.description:
Let's climb at Central Rock Gym in Watertown! Meet by the cubbies/bench facing the rock wall (they will be on the right as you enter). I (JZ) am usually wearing green and have a blue harness and climbing shoes.  We usually climb for ~3 hrs and welcome all skill levels.  If you come late, come find us or ask the CRG staff for help.  They know we climb on Tuesdays and can help you find the group.

You will need to fill out the rock gym waivers and TAKE their Belay test, if you haven't already.

Day Passes
- $20 Adult*
- $16 Student/Military
* There are also punch-cards available to get 10 Day-Passes for the price of 9 visits

Gear Rental
- $8 Full Package
- $5 Harness
- $5 Shoes
- $2 Chalk
- $2 Belay Device

Membership options and further details are available on the website. You can also fill out a waiver online to save on paperwork when you arrive at the gym.
http://www.centralrockgym.com/watertown.php
results.name: Central Rock Watertown Tuesday

results.description:
PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS HERE: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/introduction-to-onshape-cloud-based-cad-tickets-17209583327

This class will introduce people to the Onshape 3D design and collaboration tool. Onshape is free to use for Makers and runs on any laptop (Windows, Mac or Linux), chromebook, iOS device or even a Raspberry PI computer hooked up to a browser. We will learn how to best use Onshape, apply design intent and build a mechanical design collaboratively. Think Google Docs meets SolidWorks.

Lightning Overview of History of Mechanical CAD! (52 years in 15 minutes)
Onshape Demonstration (15 minutes)
Model a basic design in Onshape (60 minutes)
Basics and the User Interface
Introduction to Sketching
Basic Part Modeling in the Part Studio
Collaboration
Version Control
Assembly modeling for mechanisms
Q&A


This class will be taught by Mike LaFleche, who has been a local resource for 3D CAD. He has many years of experience with all sorts of 3D CAD systems like SolidWorks and other tools, and now with Onshape.
results.name: Introduction to OnShape: Cloud Based CAD Software

results.description:
Come join Richard and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Applebee's in Brighton. This event is part of our Tuesday Night Series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 8-16 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

 

 

 

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 9, Chestnut Hill Ave, and is walking distance from the T, near the old Circle Cinema and Boston College.

By Subway: Take the Green Line B,C, or D to Cleveland Circle, Chestnut Hill Ave, or Reservoir. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Applebee's on the opposite side of the street next to the park.

By Car: If you are driving, parking at the restaurant is ample and free. Take Rt 9 (boylston) westbound, and turn right onto Chestnut Hill Ave, or take Commonwealth Ave (Rt 30) westbound, and turn left onto Chestnut Hill Ave. The venue is at the corner of Beacon St and Chestnut Hill Avenue.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the back of the restaurant.
results.name: Tuesday Magic in Cleveland Circle - Brighton

results.description:
The weather is so much better then this past winter when this was cancelled twice- IT'S GOING TO HAPPEN THIS TIME!!

Come join the C&C crew over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford for a the after the holidays REGIFT Party. Did you get something this holiday season that just wasn't what you needed or it just doesn't go in your house or you just don't want it? Well this is the place to be for some laughs and fun and REGIFTING IT.

Bring a wrapped unwanted gift - the value of it doesn't matter because you don't want it anyway and we'll have Yankee Swap fun. As with the Yankee swap, we'll pick numbers and go up to the REGIFT table and pick a present you'll absolutely won't want. Swapping is always allowed and encouraged.

It's just for FUN so be prepared to laugh, heckle the lucky person and  always remember YOU'RE JUNK IS ANOTHER PERSONS TREASURE.

So get off the couch and come over and join in on the fun.

THIS WILL BE AN OPEN CARD AND GAME NIGHT AFTER THE SWAP.

Although we start around 6:30pm or so, early birds can take advantage of their half-price happy hour menu. These are full-portion sized appetizers for real cheap! If not, you'll still be able to take advantage of the monthly specials.

HOW TO GET THERE

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that C&C members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.
results.name: Trying this again....AFTER THE HOLIDAYS REGIFT PARTY

results.description:
Pho Dakao is a Vietnamese restaurant just north of Framingham Center.  There is a sister restaurant in Worcester.  If you have never eaten Vietnamese Food it is not as spicy as Thai food and a bit more subtle.  The food is good and it is the best Vietnamese food outside of Boston that I have found.

The restaurant's website is: http://www.phodakao.com/


<a href="http://www.taverninthesquare.com/location/northborough"></a>

The menu is here:  http://www.phodakao.com/_docs/Framingham%20Menu.pdf

Yelp reviews here: http://www.yelp.com/biz/pho-dakao-framingham

Separate checks have been requested and hopefully they will accommodate us.  

Please be considerate of the restaurant, the meetup group, and your organizer and only RSVP "Yes" if you plan to attend. If you RSVP "Yes" and your plans change, please update your RSVP to reflect that.   Also, please be on time.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
